trackinfo.title: Indigo Wildflowers
trackinfo.lyrics: I walk in through the sunbeam, partially blind. Dust particles partly obscure my line of sight. And I am just a child stepping out into the world,  Blinking my eyes, once or twice.  First exposure to light has the tendency to overwhelm. It’s not by coincidence that every baby begins with a cry. And I was just the same, growing up quickly, Filling my pockets with love and shame, In distorted measures over time. As summer skies parted in cowardice of winter’s blade. Timid young eyes watched on helplessly as crops were slayed. For the harvest is plentiful but merciless in its ways. An ancient expression of the futility of our days. Sunny coloured hues on the old oak, Honey was the sap that stuck to my fingers and thumb. Hurry, soon the food will be getting cold, Journey on through to where you’ve come from And where you’re going to. It’s all the same, only different in name, you know. Georgie was shy but he loved me, pure and bright. I kept him under my tattered wing when the wind howled at night. For the dogs come a-biting when the flesh is warm and young. Ready the gun and steady your arm to survive. Life was tough but it weren’t anything other than what we knew. And in the rough, verdant blades of grass stick together like glue. For the mud is hard and thick and the lack of oxygen makes you sick, But the surreal sense of something real and true will push you on through. And now I dream of you. In pictures of golden sun and blood red hues. Why does the rain fall on rolling hills like ours? Georgie holding in his small left hand indigo wildflowers.

trackinfo.title: Wolf
trackinfo.lyrics: Once i roamed this mountain  Lone and guarded  I snarled at the changing weather of the world Wherein how the tall men talked and Corroded the pathways I knew since i was just a cub of four years old All that i loved was spoiled by the dirt  Of a hand shifting landscapes That man had never earned Caught in the crossfire of man and the earth I ran scared and crying as it burned But as i wandered i found a home Where i could rest at ease Knowing i was known For the love that lives in me Born alone Now i roam with you I am your wolf

trackinfo.title: A Million Times
trackinfo.lyrics: 1, 2, 1 2 3 4 Early summer morning, wake up at dawn. Getting ready for a big day, tying the knot. Blurry-eyed and messy hair, I got no armour. The heavy stuff ain’t fair game when I’m in still pyjamas, no. Everybody is looking so smart, Dresses and suits and shiny shoes. We’re buzzing with an anxious hyper kind of happy, Weird a few days ago, I was so blue. Tiptoeing the glass, barefoot in the grass, Take our shoes off and let’s all have a dance. A memory’s what we make it, Brother, I love you and I’ll say it, A million times tonight. I’m rushing around amid the chaos. Got a hundred things on my mind. Like will the words evade me at the worst moment? I’m just keeping my calm, one thing at a time. Tiptoeing the glass, barefoot in the grass, Take our shoes off and let’s all have a dance. A memory’s what we make it, Brother, I love you and I’ll say it. Tiptoeing the glass, barefoot in the grass, Take our shoes off and let’s all have a dance. A memory’s what we make it, Brother, I love you and I’ll say it… Why am I always so away in my mind? Just tonight I’ll leave it all behind, As irrational as it is, My head keeps spinning round again, Wondering quietly: What if this is the last time? (that we’re all together) What if this is the last time? (that we’re all together) What if this is the last time? (that we’re all together) What if this is the last? Never knew it would go so fast. Tiptoeing the glass, barefoot in the grass, Take our shoes off and let’s all have a dance. A memory’s what we make it, Brother, I love you and I’ll say it. Tiptoeing the glass, barefoot in the grass, Take our shoes off and let’s all have a dance. A memory’s what we make it, Brother, I love you and I’ll say it, A million times, tonight. A million times, tonight. A million times. A million times.

trackinfo.title: Crying / Laughing
trackinfo.lyrics: In the early days it was involuntary  It was instinct just to sink my feelings where they lay And i got used to it, yeah i got good at it Pretending everything is fine Because it’s a sunny day As i was growing up, kept it all inside Didn’t notice how the fragments seemed to always fight Don’t wanna be alone Don’t wanna reach out, I'll hide It’s a scary world I’ve learned that about a thousand times  And it was getting worse Little by little it was building up Til it was all just totally fucked Bracing my skin with a knife Need to let it out I can only laugh, how am I alive? Let me have the space to cry Let me have the time to try Crying, laughing, I’ve been finding all these feelings. And I’m not fighting them no more. Now I’m bursting wide open. Wide open.

trackinfo.title: Eighteen Years Past
trackinfo.lyrics: I retrace my steps from 18 years past An imprint of a footprint That my younger form had cast upon the sand, A moment in time that could never last For the tides wash away and take our plans And it all dissolves so fast, an echo of a life lived and gone But it still reverberates through my body Now I return to the place it came from And it’s funny how so much has changed And yet so many things remain exactly the same And even those that have changed, are not gone, just replaced And the shores I once graced as a sweet young boy  Chasing the ephemeral Are now home to a sweet young boy  Chasing the waves And I recognise these rock formations  Like structures inside my brain And I remember climbing up there Only stopping once we'd reached the highest place I can still hear her warning me To be careful - as if this was where i was really unsafe I never felt freer than when i had triumphed that rock face And it’s still exactly the same,  I remember each slope and ledge, And it was easier then,  I was carefree, or careless. But my troubles, they weren't small They were so intense they were buried like cursed treasure Locked away inside my chest for good measure To protect myself from memories, But now I remember,  And these places are bittersweet, Bittersweet to me. And it’s funny how so much has changed And yet so many things remain exactly the same And even those that have changed, are not gone, just replaced And the shores I once graced as a sweet young boy  Chasing the ephemeral Are now home to a sweet young boy  Chasing the waves Chasing the ephemeral Chasing the day away. Climbing up off the beach, and the rocks scratch my feet. I wonder, were they always this sharp? Or was the younger me smart enough  To have worn something underneath  And the route we used to take is now closed off with red signs  So I hesitate before readily striding up to the right I hike the hill to its top, and look down from above The meadows are all gone, their vibrant grass reduced  To a rough stretch of dirt and mud And i see that some things have changed,  And yet other things remain And i still recognise this place,  Even now, with the land turned over. I can pinpoint where we camped, And where I rode my bike barefoot And just north of that spot used to be a football pitch  Where me and my brothers would play for hours  With kids we'd never met And to the east there used to be a park A little playground, its structures I can barely recall But I remember making a friend and i thought we lived quite close. I was too young to know where we lived. I was too young to have known anything… Now my eyes wander up  To the northernmost point of the meadow Where my skin shivers and trembles  Like the shrivelling of a plant  Growing under a heavy shadow It was night when i awoke  And i left in my pyjamas When i returned The sky was a little lighter,  And my world a little darkened. But I kept it all under wraps,  All that happens, all that i feel And in the morning that place retransforms  Into a corner in a field… And it’s funny how so much has changed And yet so many things remain exactly the same And even those that have changed, are not gone, but replaced And the shores I once graced as a sweet young boy  Chasing the ephemeral Are now home to a sweet young boy  Chasing the waves Chasing the ephemeral Chasing the day away.

trackinfo.title: Tidal Waves
trackinfo.lyrics: “Nature’s first green is gold, Her hardest hue to hold. Her early leaf’s a flower; But only so an hour. Then leaf subsides to leaf. So Eden sank to grief, So dawn goes down to day. Nothing gold can stay.” -	Robert Frost “Together this time?” “Yeah, together this time.” 1, 2, 1 2 3 4 And she’s coming on the night, But a tear rolls down her eye. For the love she tries to hide, And the stolen people cry: “Our love has been betrayed.” Don’t you smile like that, It takes love back, You think it’s your love that’s been thrown away. But if you can’t find me, Just remember that we’ll see, And go another way. Til tidal waves, And the waves crash on the shore. And I’ll sail to you tonight, To make our love so fine. Til tidal waves.

trackinfo.title: Graveside
trackinfo.lyrics: - written in third person, “Graveside” tells the story of the father’s death and funeral. He is survived by his four children, Jane (14), Tiffany (12), Stan (10) and Samuel (10). Set in 1986. Children standing at their father’s grave  Bearing questions from their childhood days Jane and Tiffany were shadowed in shame, oh Stan had his hands round his brothers throat Samuel had spoken in a bitter tone “Don’t tarnish the name of the dead” “Don’t you know they’ll come to haunt ya” -	Stanley Jr, 10 Janie knelt on the soil and laid Indigo flowers on their father’s grave Some are too far gone to ever be saved Samuel recovered with a cough and cry Little streams running from his youthful eyes In need of some comfort he turns to his sister Jane “And I never knew you well…” “You drank far too much and cos of that you always smelled” -	Samuel, 10  Samuel withdrew and folded the cue card in two Stan bunches his hands in fists,  Refusing to let the anger burst through  Wiping the tears out of her eyes Tif knew of more than one reason why Two weeks ago her father had to die Down in the darkness under the stairs She met up with her sister and they planned from there  A way to corner their father with a knife The blood dripped from the blade Samuel walked in and screamed until his voice was strained Now he can’t remember anything or who was to blame But the violence lives on in his brother’s name Children standing at their father’s grave Sharing stories from their childhood days The youngest was hidden in a hazy shade Stan had decided he would run away Took his father’s bottle as he went his way Jane and Tif held a secret so dark They swore they'd take it to the grave

trackinfo.title: Forever
trackinfo.lyrics: - written from the father’s perspective, “Forever” tells the tale of how their family began, and of the mother’s death. Set 1971-1979. I met you in the spring With a bundle of flowers I said I heard you sing Left me smiling for hours We were so young And love came easy A sweet six months And you told me you were having my baby And you asked Will you love me forever? And will you love her forever? Our daughter grew up So quick like the blinking of an eye When her sister was born I was late to the hospital wasn’t I? But I found us a house On maple avenue Said I’d fix it up nice A home for all of you And you asked Can we live here forever? Can we live here forever? When our sons arrived I was working double night shifts We were almost in the clear When the roof finally caved in I did all that I could, and I raised a little money  I was so relieved until it all changed suddenly You sat down by my side and said “honey…” “I won’t be here forever” -	Joan Arbury In a matter of months The sickness ate into you Your children were crying Little Jane cuddled up to you The boys were so small They fell asleep on your bed As you drew your last breath I wept I will stay here forever I will stay here forever I will stay here forever I will stay here Forever

trackinfo.title: Numb
trackinfo.lyrics: - written from Jane’s perspective, “Numb” tells of where Jane is at now, nearly twenty years later, in 2005. I feel numb again, Don’t really feel anything, Been this way, I guess, Since I was a little kid. Last thing I remember is, Cuddling up to mama_ I watch the tv news roll, It’s so depressing but I don’t care, It just goes on and on, War after war after famine. I’ve been studying, For the bar exam, If I pass, may my success last, Longer than I have. And I’m so tired, but I don’t sleep. I’m an expert liar, the secrets I keep, Would send me to the police. I feel a chill again, When Stan drunk dials me at 4am. I listen to the voicemails that he sends, Drunken ramblings beyond deciphering. I push it down again, I feel good now I don’t feel anything, Life is easy on autopilot, But the plane is nosediving. I swear that I’m trying. And when Tiffany calls, Says she’s on the train to mine, I break her fall, at the terminal, Dragging out my protective side. And just like that, I’m Janie again, And our secrets and plans, hit back like a wind, On the coastline of our childhood beach, I hold your hand as you cuddle up to me. I want to be your big sister, But I’m dead inside, ain’t much help to ya, And I don’t really have the energy, But you make me your mother, With the “Janie”

trackinfo.title: Janie
trackinfo.lyrics: - written from Jane and Tiffany’s perspective, “Janie” tells of the sisters’ bond, nearly twenty years after the death of their father. Set in 2005. You come back crash into my life like a hurricane, sister I let you stay cos despite everything i missed ya Oh Tiffany what did you do to me I am your protector I’m tired as hell, you say you’re tired as well Is that why you ran out on your children? Isn’t it time you went back home? Ill ride the train with you  I know you get scared when you’re on your own I guess some things never change Every time you come to town  I feel so strange But i don’t want none of your drama Can you promise me this Can’t lie i missed your sweet laughter  But beneath it there’s no difference  You’re still running wild Making your trouble my business Driving me crazy I’m so tired Of cleaning up your messes But you get me every time  With the "Janie" Four drinks in and the secret within  Starts to break free, you're shaking  Like a leaf in the winter breeze,  You say you’ve been experiencing memories Of his screams and the blood that he bled I tell you to keep quiet Talk of something else instead How can i? You mutter with a sigh His life and his death are ingrained in me I shouldn't have asked for you anything  Let alone a killing We put him down like a dog And you know i don’t believe But it wouldn't hurt my guilt to receive A little forgiveness from god And I know i should get back to my kids And i don’t know how he has the patience to give I’m scared i don’t deserve this life at all Can i stay here a little bit, can we share the fall? But i don’t want none of your drama Can you promise me this Can’t lie i missed your sweet laughter  But beneath it there’s no difference  You’re still running wild Making your trouble my business Driving me crazy I’m so tired Of cleaning up your messes But you get me every time  With "Janie"

trackinfo.title: Mothers
trackinfo.lyrics: - written from Tiffany’s perspective, “Mothers” tells the story of how she lost her mother when she was 4, but also includes the perspective of her own children, James and Samantha, who suffer from Tiffany’s neglect. Set in 2005. Mothers, mothers, Moths in our clothes. Eating away at the fabric of our home. Desperate, dark, scared and alone, We grew up in a motherless shadow. Mother, mother, Where did you go? James and Samantha cry in the cold, Their father stands in the doorway alone, Watching as they grow. Are we all the same? Just echoes and reverberations in a chamber. Leaves falling off trees,  The garden grows the thorns of old, The poisoned soil beneath. Mothers, mothers, Dance in the wind. Tiffany runs, From her children to sin. Everyday life feels suffocating, To the child she hides within. Scared and lonely, And motherless too, She tries to remember her, But not a clue, Just a feeling, an image or two, Before she succumbed to the illness. Tell me how it is, Is it so bad? Everything you missed, I wish you had stayed alive to see, The damage done, its happened, The mess uncovered in your absence. Mother, mother, Come home. Mother, mother, Please. Mama, mama, Want you home. Ma, ma, To me. Heaven ain’t for you, Return to me, I need you to, Please see, I’m lost and so confused, Desperate, turning in the dark. Four years old, take me to the park. Push me on the swings. Make me feel like I belong, I need these little things again, Mama, come on home. Ma, come on home.

trackinfo.title: Twin Suns
trackinfo.lyrics: - written from Samuel’s perspective, “Twin Suns” focuses on the twin boys, Samuel and Stanley Jr, and their relationship with their father. Set in 1984. I’ll be in the corner always, Venture out, there’s danger, I think I’ll stay. Here where the vultures can’t see me, But I come from their destiny. I hold the key in my hands, Which door it unlocks I don’t know yet, I’ll try every single one til I find it, And discover what’s behind my head. “Sammy, what’s the problem? Hurry up” -	Stanley Sr “I think he’s slow, dad,” -	Stan Jr Stan just laughs “Gotta man up, if you wanna be something” -	Stanley Sr God I still hear him in my head ringing I’m not the son that you want, And he is, a violent shut-off runt, You call me weak and sensitive, But maybe I should see it as a compliment. Something in me shuts down, over the years. Giving in to the shame and the fear, That you fester in me like a shadow, When someone asks me what is wrong, I don’t know. I’ve got the world in my hands, But my arms are crippled underneath your plans, I need to break free but it’s too late, All your lies ingrained me and I’m only eight. I remember when you took us both to see, Your favourite, the star wars trilogy. I cried when the twist turned a knife in me, I could see the parallels, I could see the parallels, I could see the parallels so clearly.

trackinfo.title: Runaway Train
trackinfo.lyrics: - written from Stan’s perspective, twenty years after his father’s death, “Runaway Train” tells the story of his spiral into addiction and violence. Set in 2005. And I leave a note on the table. Unreadable with a smudge of ink. And I stay in the bar til it’s closing, Did I give you enough time to think? And the darkness is unravelling, Got a monster that I need to feed. You say I’m irresponsible and lazy, I promise, I’m keeping it on a tight lead. And you shout at me on the 21st, Say good grief, you forgot again. Our anniversary, shit, I knew it was coming up, You say I’m not ready for a girlfriend. So I disappear into the night, Go out drinking, smoking and snorting lines. Getting rowdy, I get into a fight, Come home with blood on my hands, Which are gripped around a knife. I’m sinking fast, got no anchor, got no future, Life’s got my head in a deadlock and I’m choking blood, I can’t move forward but I know I should, I slide sideways, I’m a runaway train, argh… And I see you again the following year. When I see my face, yours is painted in fear. And a little shock at what I’ve become. Drunk and dirty and inescapably numb. And you cross the street as quick as you can. And I shout over the traffic jam. Try to rush between the stalling cars. But I trip and fall and break the glass. I’m sinking fast, got no anchor, got no future, Life’s got my head in a deadlock and I’m choking blood, I can’t move forward but I know I should, I slide sideways, I’m a runaway train... I’ve got to change, when I look in the mirror, I cry, eyes wide, fuck my life, I’m my father, And the violence is written in my scars, Metaphysical contagion, caught in a strange addiction. I feel the heat of the water as I step into The shower, feel its cleansing power And I shiver, withdrawal got me breaking out in sweats, But I’m gonna get better,  Yeah I'm gonna get better, yeah I’m gonna get_ Drunk, again. I slide sideways, I’m a runaway train. I slide sideways, I’m a runaway train.

trackinfo.title: Witness
trackinfo.lyrics: – written from Samuel’s perspective, “Witness” tells of Samuel’s repressed memories resurfacing nearly twenty years later, as he remembers how his father died. Set in 2005. In the morning I walk in Rub my eyes til they’re not blurry  And the violence lives  On my retinas eternally See my carpet in red Like a dream sequence in my head Try to block it out  Try to turn it down But it keeps coming back again Like a fuelled up furnace Combustion in reverse  It’s a spark in my mind The curtain closing And the past reopening  Tearing me blind I pushed it all down Til the memory drowned But its resurfacing in real time  I can’t change this, I’m a witness to the crime And I’m all, and I’m all Out of my mind And I’m all, and I’m all Out of my mind So I meet up with Jane And I try to calmly explain That I remember seeing him lay On the floor the day he died And the strangest thing Was you and Tiffany In the background blurred Dressed in dark red shirts And I can’t discern my imagination  From reality And she looks at me From across the table With fear in her eyes  And she holds my hand And say she understands  Why I’m scared to hear her reply We can’t change what we did And I can’t change that I was a witness To their crime And I’m all, and I’m all Out of my mind And I’m all, and I’m all Out of my mind Like a fuelled up furnace Combustion in reverse  It’s a flame in my mind The curtain closing And the past reopening  Tearing me blind I pushed it all down Til the memory drowned But its resurfacing in real time  I can’t change this, I’m a witness to your crime And I’m all, yeah I’m all Out of my mind And I’m all, yeah I’m all Out of my mind And I’m all, and I’m all Out of my mind And I’m all, and I’m all Out of my mind

trackinfo.title: Last Days of Spring
trackinfo.lyrics: - written from the father’s perspective, “Last Days of Spring” focuses on his spiralling mental health and descent into grief-fuelled alcoholism and delusions. Set in 1986. Joan said her favourite time of year was the spring, Cos the flowers would bloom and the lambs would sing, But it’s not the same without her beside me. Joan said the spring was her favourite of year, But now my time is spent on despair and fear, Trying to keep it down, and keep myself together. But I am drowning deep, And this family I can’t keep together, Hanging on by a thread. And I think they’ll be better off without me, There was something in my head, As I went to buy another bottle, To wash down the medicine. Joan said her favourite time of year was the spring, But I went out walking through the farmer’s fields and felt nothing, The aching in my head just grows a little heavier. Joan said she loved me but I never knew why, Guess I maybe should’ve asked her before she said goodbye, Walked into that night, I wish I could follow her. Cos I am drowning deep, And this family I can’t keep together, We’re hanging on by a thread. And the lights change from red to green, I stall the car and hear a hundred beeps, Behind me, but I’m somewhere else. I’m with my love, On the last days of spring, Bringing her back, With alcohol-induced hallucinations. I’m with my love, On the last day of spring, I’m with my love, I’m with my love.

trackinfo.title: Whirlwind
trackinfo.lyrics: - written in third person and from Tiffany and Stan’s perspectives, “Whirlwind” explores the final days of the father’s life, as his abusive behaviour pushed his daughters into plotting his murder. Set in 1986. He wakes to discover, His children are all gone, It’s midday, they’re at school, When they get back, he’ll drunk. It’s been like this for years now, But Tif has had enough, She hates his constant gaze, Now she’s twelve and a half. Jane tells her little brothers To go straight to their room, Samuel sulks and Stan bunches his hand, Punches the wall. Tif lights up a cigarette, Smoking in the bathroom, There’s no lock, 4 o’clock and it’s bad news. I don’t care (lies I tell myself) I’m barely there (will someone help?) I’ve been caught in your whirlwind, And I’m always hurting, But I can’t speak up, Cos that ain’t an option, And it’s not worth the cost if you even hear it. Sam hides in her covers, And Jane makes room for him. She’s used to being mother, To two of three children. Stan leaves in the night-time, He’s looking for trouble, He throws a brick through his neighbour’s window. The cops detain him (son where’s your father?) Nobody saves him (he’s passed out, ain’t he?) I’ve been caught in your whirlwind, And I’m scared I deserve it, Am I a broken child? Will they pull the curtain? Of nothing, I’m certain, Except that I will die, Caught in your whirlwind, Father, we’re hurting, You’re too drunk to realise. We’re caught in your whirlwind, The pain is unfurling, We’re caught in your_ We’re caught in your_ We're caught in your... Whirlwind... I don’t care (lies I tell myself) I’m barely there (will someone help?) I don’t mind (Janie, something’s wrong) I hand you the knife…

trackinfo.title: Family Reunion
trackinfo.lyrics: - written from Jane’s perspective, “Family Reunion” shows the four siblings reunite at their childhood home twenty years after their father’s death. Set in 2006. If I go under, help me up. If we’re to suffer, let there be blood. I meet you at the house, on maple avenue. It looks rougher, in the modern view. It’s been twenty years, since we were last here. I remember the panic, the crying, the shouting, the unrelenting fear. I remember me and Tiffany, sitting in the station. She held my hand under the desk as we sat silent through the investigation. I remember taking the plastic yellow gloves out from under the sink. When they find the knife, I said, it’s gotta not have our fingerprints. I remember you crying, saying “I just want this to be over” I’ve got your back, I’m your sister, I’ll see you through to the clear. This can only end in a death, Make sure it’s not ours. We watched as he drew his last breath, Now I’m buying his flowers. Twenty years and the guilt still remains, Like an etching in your brain. I hold your hand, ain’t letting it go, But your tears still fall like November’s rain. Stan gets out of his car, Parked a little askew. His breathing is strong and harsh, He’s had a couple more than a few. I tell him go back home, He says he’s home right now. He’s staring back at the door, Behind it’s where it all went down. Samuel arrives, he doesn’t say a word. All of my siblings in a line, I say that this might hurt. They’re gonna demolish this place, Erase its history. Return dust to dust, I guess, But it roots will live on in you and me. It’s all over, The ashes of the past. The physical reminders behind us, Were never going to last. But the scars still show, Deep and dark and red. And when we go inside for the last time, I can still see the blood he bled. If you go under, don’t give up. I know we all suffered but we never should’ve. We meet outside the house on maple avenue. I think it’ll look better when it’s dust and rubble, don’t you?

trackinfo.title: Last I Heard
trackinfo.lyrics: - written from Jane and Tiffany’s perspectives, the two sisters talk about their brothers and where they’re at. The final verse is written in third person and acts as an epilogue for all four siblings, showing where they ended up. Set in 2005 and then in 2025, nearly forty years after their father’s death, as we learn of where the four Arbury siblings are now. Last I heard, Samuel was working at a bar Three feet off the ground  Living month to month Last I heard Stan was living in Detroit Got no answer last I called Can’t lie i don’t care much for that boy If he wants to throw his life away He can go ahead  I don’t care I’m not saying that if he died I’d be glad He’s my brother I do love him  But he reminds me of... Last I saw him Samuel told me he felt scared  As a child and that his memory Was vague and blurred and hardly there I know that he was only ten when dad died When he died? When you and I Cornered him in the kitchen with the carving knife Don’t remind me don’t put that image back in my brain  I don’t want to think about him Or the carpet blood stained I know that it wasn’t my fault for what he did How he made me feel small Made my body twist round his I just want him gone And his memory too Guess the knife wasn’t enough It just passed along the bruise To you, do you hate me now too? Last i heard  Jane was working 9 to 5 Became a lawyer working murder cases The irony is rife  Last i heard Tiffany gave up on her kids Her husband asked her for a divorce And she tore the house to bits Last i heard Stan overdosed in an alleyway Got rushed to the hospital just too late Samuel wrote a cue card to recite at his grave Last i heard Samuel saved up a little cash Bought a car and drove away Never looked back Never looked back Thank god for that That he never looked back, Never look back.

trackinfo.title: Inheritance (Graveside II)
trackinfo.lyrics: - written in third person, “Inheritance” shows the father and his four children at Joan’s grave. Set in 1979. Children crying at their mother’s grave, Sharing stories from their childhood days, Jane and Tiffany were holding the frame. Stan had his hand in his brother’s hold, Twins in the sunset of a late spring glow, Darkness overhead as the shadows grow. Stanley knelt on the soil and laid, April flowers on his late wife’s grave, Four kids behind, and what future remains? Samuel quivered in the frosty air, Summer was near, but the sun wasn’t there, Time is a dragon feeding on despair. “I never knew quite why,” “You loved me, but some reason, you did” “Why did you have to die?” Stanley withdraws, from the graveside, And down deep into his thoughts, “I will never survive” “I will never survive” Children crying at their mother’s grave, Eight and six and four years of age, Too young to know how the paths are paved. Time runs wild and the seasons change, But even as they pass, some things still remain, Ways of being and blood in your veins, Passed down your way.

terrapin.title: Innerexternal
terrapin.about:
This is a double album, so feel free to listen the whole way through or split it into 1-10 and 11-20, as they work on their own too! The first half is more upbeat and the second half is darker and slower. Anyways, hope you enjoy.
-Quin / Terrapin

trackinfo.title: Intro / Wonderful Day
trackinfo.lyrics: Intro (Mother Nature) Hold us, mother nature, Guide us with your kindness. Cast from us our sorrow, And dwell in us a light. Hold us, mother nature, Guide us with your kindness. Cast from us our sorrow, And dwell in us a light. Wonderful Day Down where the old oak tree grows, I think I saw you there. Turning round, floating out, With flowers in your hair. Days would pass, summer came, Warmed our bones for a month. Gave us strength, made us brave, There, I met you once. And you would say, “What a wonderful day we’ve had.” And you would say, “What a wonderful day we’ve had, And I wouldn’t spend it, With anyone else.”

trackinfo.title: '79 AMC Spirit
trackinfo.lyrics: On the day I turn eighteen,  I’m escaping, There’s no doubt about it. Stole my father’s second car, A beat-up ’79 AMC Spirit. Gonna drive til I run out of gas, Gonna rob a station, And run off real fast, Like in a movie, I’m in a movie, And I’m the top name on the cast. In my AMC Spirit, I don’t fear nothing, Cos anything may come. And I’ll be ready for it. Yeah, I’m armed to the teeth, With my one shot pistol gun. And if they shoot back, Yeah, even if I get shot in the back, Yeah, I won’t feel it. I’m too numb to feel it. In my AMC Spirit, The highway is empty, And paradise is the next exit. Every mile of tarmac greets me, Hot and dark, Like the tar in my mind. It’s been a life-long headache, And I know, Sometimes you’ve got to let go. And blow everything to hell! Yeah, and fuck everyone as well! And hail Satan! Hail Satan! Sometimes, I get tired of the road, I get lonely, and I get homesick in a way, I can’t describe, Life is just a lie, To cover up for the death. Well, I know what I am, And I will die in this seat, I’ve got something like a blood bond With my father’s ’79 AMC Spirit. Yeah, blow everything to hell, And fuck everyone as well, And hail Satan! Hail Satan. The day I turned eighteen, I was escaping, There was no doubt about it. Just stole my father’s car, Yeah, a ’79 AMC Spirit. Gonna drive til I run out gas, Gonna rob a station, And run off real fast, Like in a movie, I’m in a movie, And my name is at the top of the cast.

trackinfo.title: The Role of Hero
trackinfo.lyrics: I’ve got the role of hero, The kids are chanting “he’s behind you!” I cannot see him there though, And I forget nearly all of my lines. trackinfo.title: a quick one
trackinfo.lyrics: Old ways, old days gone past. I’ll wait, I’ll change my direction. Old lies, come back to haunt you. You’ll be alright one day. Tell me, what you wanted to say. Cos, I don’t want to hold up any longer. Cos, we’ll be, we’ll be always afraid, Of what’s on our shoulders. Old ways, old days gone past.

trackinfo.title: eye of the storm
trackinfo.lyrics: You reach an age, Where you realise that the two things you’ve learned, Is 99% of everything you wanted to do and you wanted to be, Will never happen. And that everything you thought wasn’t that bad when you were a kid, It was that bad. And I know more than I let on. You might think I’m dumb, But I know more than I let on. Maybe I understand this world, A little bit more than you think I do. Maybe I’m the one, who knows more than everyone. I’m not trying to brag, I am not an arrogant twat, I just know myself and I’m not in denial of the world, And it’s all wrong. It’s all wrong. How can we belong? And carry on? Well, my clothes are made in shops that exploit kids. And my food travels across the globe and pollutes the sky. Our world is crying out, yeah, we’ll all gonna die, Or at least, this civilisation, will collapse into the sea and drown, Will we drown with it? What’s the point in complaining? I don’t know, I don’t know. What’s the point in trying to explain it? I don’t know, I don’t know. Is there even a point in singing this song? Isn’t this wrong as well? Cos, everything I am is just the things I’ve seen, And the things I’ve heard. The things I’ve felt and the things I’ve been told. Some things I’ve taken in as family, And others I’ve treated like enemies. I was to shake me and I’m about to blow. I’m a machine in control of what? Nothing at all. Nothing at all. What’s the point in playing notes that sound good, anymore? Cos it’s all just sounds in the end, it’s all just sounds in an ocean. And we are floating down, downstream, into a point, Into the ocean, floating out, floating further than we know. I don’t, I don’t know. I don’t, I don’t know, How to end this song, With no discernible direction. I’ll probably just fade out. I’ve made it too meta now. And I like my friends and I like my meals. But the storm is close, the storm is real. Yeah, I love my gran and I love my brothers. But why do I care for some? And not think a fuck about so many fucking others? It’s a joke, it’s a joke. It’s a joke.

trackinfo.title: everything is temporary
trackinfo.lyrics: Everyone round here has a secret, No-one will tell you theirs and you would never keep it. You would never keep it. Down by the docks, I watch the water, Run through the ocean. I’ll be the one you want to hold, When you’re feeling so lonely. And these dark, cold nights, They come and go. And all the waves crash upon the shore. Will we hope for more life? Will we hope for more life? Well, everything is temporary, Everything is temporary. Everything is temporary, Everything is temporary. Everything is temporary, Everything, everything, You and me, The universe, reality. I’ll be awake, are you? Can I talk to you? I know, I know it’s 4AM, And you’re probably dead asleep, But I need to hear your voice. I need to hear your voice. I’m crying in my sleep, crying in my nightmares. I’m crying when I wake and when I go down the stairs. I remember way too much, So, I forget it and then I regret not thinking about it so much, Cos maybe I’m faking all of this shit in my head, Maybe I was just screaming out for something, When I said I wanted to be dead, And I don’t feel so good. I don’t feel so good. I don’t feel so good. I don’t feel so good.

terrapin.title: leaves for u
terrapin.about: *btw an extra 5 bonus tracks come with purchasing the album :D

trackinfo.title: call me leper, call me saint
trackinfo.lyrics: Call me leper, call me saint, Cover me with feathers and pitch-black paint. Swallow the poison and wallow in the pain. Practice patience, rehearse restraint. All these fuckers are coming for you, Keep your eyes open and sharpen your tooth. Blood is thick and guns are heavy, You might feel sick, but just stay steady. Just stay steady. I see puddles of a deep dark red, My little brother is lying there dead. “Fuck me, fuck me!” The thought in my head, Saying it’s all your fault, All your fault this ever happened. Skeletal, fragile, like paper in the rain. Claustrophobic and covered in his bloodstains. I was just a child with an empty mind, But I was an accessory to a crime, And I knew it. Fuck it, it’s my fault,  I blew it. So, call me leper, call me a saint! Cover me with feathers and pitch-black paint. Swallow the poison and wallow in the pain, Practice patience, rehearse restraint. I see puddles of a deep dark red, My little brother is lying there dead. “Fuck me, fuck me!” The thought in my head, Saying, “it’s all your fault,”  “it’s your fault this ever happened.”
trackinfo.credits: from leaves for u, released January 14, 2023

trackinfo.title: guide me
trackinfo.lyrics: When will you come back? I’ve been waiting, here forever. Sighs, they break my fall. And I get lost in the places we call home. All my time, I’ve been watching the wrong thing, Just trying to fly by without navigation. So, it’s fine to replace the pieces I ruined. See, you’re letting go. Down the place we used to roam. What could you say? So lost up your ass, You can’t speak for days. When will you haul me back again? Cos I’ve been missing your ways. Though, you smother me like a mother hen, I still love you, I want your hand guiding me through this maze.
trackinfo.credits: from leaves for u, released January 14, 2023

trackinfo.title: thought farm II
trackinfo.credits: from leaves for u, released January 14, 2023

trackinfo.title: baby judas
trackinfo.lyrics: Oh, I’ve come to see the baby Judas, Lying in his crib, crying, sucking on his thumb. I’ve come to see the baby Judas, Crying in his crib, sleep through gentle dreams. Did he know what would become of him? More than anyone knows anything? I’ve come to see the baby Judas, Lying asleep in his crib, I’ve come to see the baby Judas. Which one of us chooses what comes of us? I went to see him, Eight years down the line. Saw how the other kids treat him, Then that evening, I heard his father beat him. And though he tried to be kind, They didn’t know what he was meaning. And everyone was so demeaning, And the boy, kid took a beating. I’ve come to see the baby Judas, I’ve come to see what chooses, Our fates, in the end. I’ve come to see the baby Judas, I’ve come to see, What if we choose the ones that bleed? And those that lose it? I wonder what became of him. Maybe we become nothing.
trackinfo.credits: from leaves for u, released January 14, 2023

trackinfo.title: constellations
trackinfo.lyrics: Days consumed by night, All blood spilt in a fight, Call out to me, I’ll seek you. And when I’m scared, Hold my hand. And when you feel unprepared, I’ll walk you through a plan, And you’ll say, “I feel so lost in this place,” I’ll say, “Look at the constellations,” “And we’ll find home.” And we’ll find home, Yeah, we’ll find home again. Every day, I try to think, About the days in which the water was rough, I thought that I might sink. I might drown and never breathe fresh air again, What would I do? What would I do then? Maybe I’m alone, maybe life is scary. Maybe I’ll feel low, maybe I can’t help it. Maybe I am cold, would you be here with me? Would you be a stronghold? Be my armour, be my dignity, be my safety. Be my safety. And I don’t know what I would do, Without you, without you. Yeah, I don’t know what I would do, Without you, without you.
trackinfo.credits: from leaves for u, released January 14, 2023

trackinfo.title: blake saw angels
trackinfo.lyrics: I heard Blake saw angels, Up there in them trees, Maybe they are watching over me. I heard Blake saw angels, There up in the trees. Maybe they were just birds, And he saw what he wanted to see. May be all your visions, As real you see me. Cos, maybe I’ve seen angels, Flying through to me. Open up my eyes, Twofold vision. Open up my mind, Give me precision. Open up my eyes, Seeing twofold always. Open up my heart, I will love you today and tomorrow, For the rest of our lives. For the rest of our lives! And we might see angels, There up in the sky. But I heard Blake saw angels, And darling, so do I.
trackinfo.credits: from leaves for u, released January 14, 2023

trackinfo.title: tell me lies
trackinfo.lyrics: Make it better, make it worse. You will do what you want, it’s okay. It’s how it works; it’s how we work. Start repeating or start to pain. I don’t care, I don’t care, It’s all the same. You can break me in two, You can say that we are through. But don’t you think I’ll know when you mean it? And don’t you think I’ll see it in your eyes? Cos, darling, I know, Every time you tell me lies.
trackinfo.credits: from leaves for u, released January 14, 2023

trackinfo.title: don't wait up for me
trackinfo.lyrics: All lost in a dream, The seamlessness of everything. Lost, lost in the dream, I cannot see anything. But I’ll be here waiting, Don’t wait up for me in the evening, Cos, I will be gone, And you cannot find me.
trackinfo.credits: from leaves for u, released January 14, 2023

terrapin.title: mesmerised by the mess
terrapin.about:
making this album was at times a gruelling process but for the most part, it was a joy, and something of a transformative process in writing and recording - which included over 30 takes of a single song XD anyways, I hope you enjoy the music,
lots of love,
terrapin / quin x
content warnings:
- tracks 1, 2, 8, 10, 13, 14, 15 & 18 contain strong language
- tracks 4, 8, 12, 14, 17 and 19 contain themes of trauma

trackinfo.title: synonymous
trackinfo.lyrics: Growing up and becoming depressed, Became synonymous in my fucked up head. Tried to laugh away the dread, But it poisoned my soul, what did I expect? Wake up in the middle of the night, There’s someone at the window. A silhouette of demonic hell awaiting out in the cold. The clock is loud, I hear every sound, Reverberating in my head. Somebody mumbled from inside my skull, And said, “I kinda wish I was dead.” Growing up and becoming depressed, Synonymous in my fucked up head. I can’t wait to live up north, I’ll climb the mountains every morning, Wandering across the moors, Talking to the rabbits and the fawns. Imagination takes my hand, I don’t want to, I don't want to understand. Imagination holds me tight, Till I can’t breathe in the poison sky. Growing up and becoming depressed, Synonymous in my fucked up head. Tried to laugh away all the dread, But it poisoned my soul, what did I expect? Growing up and becoming depressed, Became synonymous in my fucked up head. Tried to laugh away the dread, But it poisoned my soul, what did I expect?
trackinfo.credits: from mesmerised by the mess, released November 18, 2023

trackinfo.title: leafy soup
trackinfo.lyrics: Getting stressed again, Losing my hair like middle-aged men, With jobs they resent, And wives they can’t compliment, Life is a parasite sucking out the oxygen, From my ramshackle mind. And I’m left behind. Well, I know I let myself go, Got fat and lazy, Always taking a toke. Look for an outlet, My fork fucking spoke, Now I am sitting in a church, With a cuppa leafy soup, Listening to amy 2, By the blessed mountain goats. Now, I wake up with scratches on my legs, God only knows what’ll happen next, Me and my angel having breakup sex. But I’m just overthinking my life again, And maybe Jesus Christ counts as a friend, Remember when we were just wee bastardly kids? Remember Leo, your Gonian imaginary friend? Let’s make a cuppa and sit by the fire, The devil’s a liar, but I’m alright, I’m made my amends, Peace of mind became my best friend. Cuppa leafy soup in my hands, And I don’t think about the end, That much anymore.
trackinfo.credits: from mesmerised by the mess, released November 18, 2023

trackinfo.title: little thoughts
trackinfo.lyrics: all my little thoughts, running round my brain, slow neural decay. Making me paranoid Of every big scary boy That comes across my way All my little thoughts, Running round my brain, turning me insane Whispering and they say, “why do we even talk anymore?” “it’s obvious we have nothing left to say.” I wish I could explain, But the thoughts get in the way, I’m a passenger on a pilotless plane. Oh my little thoughts, running round my brain, slow neural decay. Oh my little thoughts, turning me insane, but I'll be okay, i'll be okay, i'll be okay... i'll be okay.... i'll be okay... cos all my little thoughts running round my brain slow neural decay...
trackinfo.credits: from mesmerised by the mess, released November 18, 2023

trackinfo.title: mesmerised by the mess
trackinfo.lyrics: Well, how was I calm? In your caress, I was mesmerised by the mess. I thought I felt love, I must confess, But I didn’t know what, That was back then. I was just a shadow of who I am, You moulded me hollow, And filled me with your ideas and plans, I didn’t know how to trust or love, I didn’t know who the hell I was. I’m waking from this slumber, You’ve taken enough numbers, Of my years, so much of my life. I’ll rise above this fear of you before I die. I was locked in your cage, And instructed to sing, Then my bones you’d break, With your words as you curse me for my sin. And time is an arrow, marching ever forward, I was mesmerised by the mess of it all.
trackinfo.credits: from mesmerised by the mess, released November 18, 2023

trackinfo.title: irys (i remember you singing)
trackinfo.lyrics: Summer, somehow the sun wasn’t there, But that’s Albion for ya, to be fair. Autumn came, bringing amber leaves, And showers of rain, And the wind blew, I fell right through. Catch me, brother, before I descend to a plane, Of insanity, balancing the love and the hate, Inside my wee sickly brain. I remember you singing, Wake me up when September ends. I remember feeling high on believing, We will always be friends, We will always be best friends. I remember you singing, Wake me up, wake me up inside. I remember thinking are we really alright? But this life is deceiving, And death appears to be the only truth. I remember feeling high on believing, I’ll always have me and you. It’ll always be me and you. I remember you singing, Paradise city by guns and roses. I remember feeling scared, That the lid of my casket was closing. Cos the darkness inside me was opening. I remember hoping, hoping, That this fear would end, end. And you and I will always be best friends.
trackinfo.credits: from mesmerised by the mess, released November 18, 2023

trackinfo.title: rafael
trackinfo.lyrics: When I come back home, You will run to me or I will seek you. Sleeping on my bed already, Like you knew I was coming. When we cuddle on the sofa, I feel warm inside, inside, And on my lap, you make me so happy, That I can smile, smile. Raffi, Rafael, My Raffa, my happy lil boy. When I cry, and I cry in a well, You’ll make me feel alright again, always. Always. Raffi, Rafael, My Raffa, my happy fluffy boy. When I cry, and I cry in a well, You’ll make me feel alright again. Raffi, Rafael, My Raffa, my happy lil boy. When I cry, and I cry in a well, You’ll make me feel alright again, always. Always. Always. Always... Always.
trackinfo.credits: from mesmerised by the mess, released November 18, 2023

trackinfo.title: inside / outside
trackinfo.lyrics: Don’t say you don’t miss me, Cos I’m pretty sure that you do, You called me thirteen times. And though I’d love to hang out with you, I don’t have it in me to go outside. But would you stay inside with me? Stay inside with me. When I awake, panic all over my face, I’m in a state, heavy head and tired for days. Baggy eyes and baggy clothes, Hiding under the duvet. When you call my phone, I pretend I’m not there, Cos I’m a fool,  and I can’t pick up the courage, To pick up the call. I wish you knew that I love you, But you don’t know anything, I feel about you at all. But don’t say you don’t miss me, Cos I’m pretty sure that you do, You called seventeen times this week. And though I’d love to hang with you, I don’t have it in me to go outside. I don't want to go outside. Don’t say you don’t miss me, Cos I’m pretty sure that you do, You called me seventeen times this week. And though I’d love to hang with you, I don’t have it in me to go outside. But would you stay inside with me? Would you stay inside with me? Would you stay inside with me? Oh, darling let's stay inside.
trackinfo.credits: from mesmerised by the mess, released November 18, 2023

trackinfo.title: never underestimate a puppy
trackinfo.lyrics: Never underestimate a puppy They can bark but they can bite. Never take advantage cos you’re lucky, I won’t go down without a fight. Fuck the bastards and assholes, Who ain’t got right of mind. I will stand for Georgie, And all my friends who got left behind. Look me in the eye, Can you really forgive me? I don’t know if I could anymore. Devil on the line, I was caught in the crossfire, In my mind, into the molten core. Never underestimate a puppy They can bark but they can bite. Never take advantage cos you’re lucky, I won’t go down without a fight. Fuck the bastards and assholes, Who ain’t got right of mind. I will stand for Jonah, And all my friends who got left behind. Starting up early Sunday morning, I hear ya revving on the old engine again. The day is dark, you say that night is falling, And we’re never gonna question it. Never underestimate a puppy They can bark but they can bite. Never take advantage cos you’re lucky, I won’t go down without a fight. Fuck the bastards and assholes, Who ain’t got right of mind. I will stand for Elizabeth, And all my friends who got left behind. I will stand for Isobel, And all my friends who got left behind. Time is like a ghost and I’m transparent, I am losing my grasp on reality. But maybe I am stronger than apparently, You say I am, but I won’t listen to this bullshit you feed me. Never underestimate a puppy They can bark but they can bite. Never take advantage cos you’re lucky, I won’t go down without a fight. Fuck the bastards and assholes, Who ain’t got right of mind. Cos I will stand for Davey, And all my friends who got left behind. I will stand for Georgie, And all my friends who got left behind.
trackinfo.credits: from mesmerised by the mess, released November 18, 2023

trackinfo.title: lonely girl
trackinfo.lyrics: Born and raised a boy, Caught up in false pretences, I didn’t choose to employ, I was helpless in this scheme, This system of repressed femininity. I always tried my best, But always felt like I had failed, Everyone who was cheering on for me, And they can tell there’s something wrong with me. They know it but they don’t know it, I’m a lonely girl. I may know it but I don’t show it, I’m a lonely girl. I'm a lonely girl, I'm a lonely girl. Everyone I meet says I’m different, And I don’t always know what they mean. I don’t understand these unwritten rules, I wasn't taught this shit in school. Sometimes, all I want to do is cry into my pillow, And just melt into my shadow, Turn me back to an animal. Loosen all the threads, I am stuck inside my head, I don’t want to end up dead, But I don’t want to look like this. I don't want to end up dead, but I don't want to live like this. They know it but they don’t know it, I’m a lonely girl. I may know it but I don’t show it, I’m a lonely girl. I'm a lonely girl. Would you free me from this prison? In this darkness, I need some light to shine through my prism. They know it but they don’t know it, I’m a lonely girl. I may know it but I don’t show it, I’m a lonely girl. I'm a lonely girl, I'm a lonely girl. I'm alone.
trackinfo.credits: from mesmerised by the mess, released November 18, 2023

trackinfo.title: under their thumb
trackinfo.lyrics: Under their thumb, every day and night. Babies grow numb under their guard dog eyes. We all jump at once but never quite in time. The writing’s in blood, but the ending’s ours to realise. They take twice of all we have. They break your spirit til you’re desperate for half of that. Under their thumb, we’re all in the line of the firing gun. Told you to run, the wolves of tyranny always come. They silence what is sung to free the blinded ones. Under their thumb, what’s left for humankind to become? Falling in love, only hate could claim a crime. It’s not damn enough, to give a little and say we’re fine. Just look at the numbers, look at every young one that dies For fear of the world outside, that see us as less than humankind, But who is really kind? And what is left behind? What is left behind? They take twice of all we have. They break your spirit til you’re desperate for half of that. The bastards are drunk on power, they’ve got guns and knives. They lock us up, for flowers and call it justice, what a fucking lie! They hold all the wealth, and cheat us of our healthcare, Leave us dead and blind. I want to cry, I want to scream into their thick old minds. Cos they take twice of all we have. They break your spirit til you’re desperate for half of that. Under their thumb, we’re all in the line of the firing gun. I told you to run, cos the wolves of tyranny always come. They silence what is sung to free the blinded ones. Under their thumb, what is left for humankind?
trackinfo.credits: from mesmerised by the mess, released November 18, 2023

trackinfo.title: silly things
trackinfo.lyrics: Don’t forget the silly things, Life is tough enough as it is. Try to laugh, it’s fun to take the piss, Out of this life, this nightmare, Spark a light in the abyss. You don’t have to be alone. I know how it feels like there’s no-one to lean upon, I’ve been there before and I don’t want to go back no more. So, let me walk you home. Let me make you smile while I sing. Tell me secrets that you’ve never told, And we can find a little happiness in the silly things. Yeah, we can find a little happiness in the silly things. Yeah, we can find a little happiness, in the silly things.
trackinfo.credits: from mesmerised by the mess, released November 18, 2023

trackinfo.title: jonah
trackinfo.lyrics: Well I was never quite enough And I was never taught love The diamond is made to be tough, so they said Oh I only knew to be good  And to do as I was told I should I let their lies seep deep inside my head But it’s not my fault And I hope they’re all dead I hope they're all dead Jonah always bites back No fear of consequence  Always kinda reckless I love him now  Jonah always fights back Never fully down Always got a plan To get them back somehow  Taught me pain is temporary But love will never fade It’s always there in spades If you know where to look All this evil will go So baby brother don’t Let it devour your soul No no no no They got knives, they got guns, We got nought. This ain’t gonna go the way we thought. You climbed the tower and fell, Elizabeth yelled, “please be alright,” But the night was closing in. Be by my side, inside my soul, Inside my heart, inside my skin. Jonah always bites back No fear of consequence  Always kinda reckless I love him now  Jonah always bites back Never fully down Always got a plan To get them back somehow Well, you told me I was enough, And you made me feel real love, You awoke the rebel in my soul, And though you’re gone, I won’t ever let you go. And though you're gone, I won't ever let you go, No, no, no, no...
trackinfo.credits: from mesmerised by the mess, released November 18, 2023

trackinfo.title: a lot on my mind
trackinfo.lyrics: We go out walking lakeside All the time u were thinking I was alright Always talking but your eyes are blind And I know we are sinking  But we’re lost to the tide  When I say what I feel I mean it I don’t lie I don’t bullshit When I said that I love you I meant it I don’t lie I don’t bullshit  Oh I’ve got a lot on my mind But I’ll be fine just stay with me And I’ll be better in time Oh I’ve got a lot on my mind But I’ll be fine just stay with me And we’ll be like Snufkin and little my Winter’s coming, no warning, nothing, I know. It’s like summer got murdered and September flew by. War has doubled, multiple continents on fire, Scratch your eyes out, sanitize your doubt, And prepare your goodbyes. Oh I’ve got a lot on my mind But I’ll be fine just stay with me And I’ll be better in time Oh I’ve got a lot on my mind But I’ll be fine just stay with me And we’ll be like Snufkin and little my When I said that I love you I meant it I don’t lie I don’t bullshit

trackinfo.title: fire escape
trackinfo.lyrics: Fire escape, they’re knocking at the front door. Closed the blinds, lie down on the floor. Nobody’s home, make it look empty for sure. We’re just ghosts in this world, But we dream of something more, Something pure. Something pure... Georgie, my strange little orphan kid brother. Hide under my wing, precious motherfucker. We’ve got work in the city, you can sleep on my shoulder on the train. I’ll be there with sprites and chocolates when you awake. When you awake... Fire escape, they’re knocking at the front door. Closed the blinds, lie down on the floor. Nobody’s home, make it look empty for sure. We’re just ghosts in this world, But we dream of something more, Something pure. Something pure... Fire escape, they're knocking at the front door. Fire escape, they're knocking at the front door.
trackinfo.credits: from mesmerised by the mess, released November 18, 2023

trackinfo.title: losing it
trackinfo.lyrics: Well, I can’t go to school cos the tech is fucked, And I can’t get through to my father above, I get real loose, smoking up all my bud, And I dream of you, and we’d fuck real rough. And I get shot down and I stand back up, And I get knocked out and I think it’s my luck, Kinda numb, kinda happy, kinda dumb of me to ask, But I’m losing it, so tell me, Is there anything in you that cares? And if ya don’t, well, no worries, I think that’s kinda fair. I’m losing it, losing it, loosening the rhythm til it’s bare. There’s war on the news, to the east and its middle, It’s like we’ve gotten used to it, seen it since we were little. Death is all around me and somehow I’m alive? I don’t know much but I don’t wanna die. I don’t know much but I don’t wanna die, anymore.
trackinfo.credits: from mesmerised by the mess, released November 18, 2023

trackinfo.title: sunday afternoons
trackinfo.lyrics: Cold November,  Rainy Sunday afternoons. I remember singing to the moon, And crying. When I’m crying, You’ll be gone and if you’re there, You will tell me to stop it, It ain’t gonna change a thing, My crying. Self-care is selfish, so you said. Do you care if I’m careless? Til I’m dead. Up the ramp, Up the ramp, Up the ramp… I start lying, Keeping the truth hidden away, I am smiling, Nobody sees that it’s fake. I’ve been trying, Not to look like I’m afraid. But I’ve been crying. Yeah, I’m crying. Self-care is selfish, so you said. But do you care if I’m careless? Til I’m dead. Up the ramp, Up the ramp, Up the ramp… Cold November,  Rainy Sunday afternoons. I remember singing loud out to the moon, And crying.
trackinfo.credits: from mesmerised by the mess, released November 18, 2023

trackinfo.title: deprived of air
trackinfo.lyrics: It’s not over, winter’s always there, On the horizon, every night, laid out bare. There’s a graveyard full of secrets, Take me there, take me there. When you cry out, I will hold you tight. Like you held me through the fiery night. There’s no surrender, it’s just play pretend. There’s no end, there’s no end. Look out, don’t call out for your mama. They will fight you down til you’d rather drown. Keep close, don’t lose hope, little brother. They’ll fall one day, we’ll make our escape, I promise. I promise. But do you see my face riddled with guilt and shame? Do you see my eyes filled with tears as you call my name? Am I still your friend? Do you still believe I care? Can we still find hope when we’re deprived of air? Look out, don’t call out for your mama. They will fight you down til you’d rather drown. Keep close, don’t lose hope, little brother. They’ll fall one day, we’ll make our escape, I promise. I promise. I promise... I promise. Cos there’s a graveyard full of secrets, I’ll take you there, I’ll take you there. Cos we’ve been dying, time and time again, Deprived of air, deprived of air. There’s a graveyard full of our feelings, You know I care, don’t you know I still care? And are we still dying? Well please live on in my mind. Deprived of air, deprived of mine.

trackinfo.title: mayfly spirit

trackinfo.title: sometimes it's ok
trackinfo.lyrics: I still hear you say, Sometimes it’s ok, ok to feel sad. I shouldn’t have stayed, But I was just eight, And you were all I had. I needed a friend, So my mind played pretend, And fawned to be glad. That you took me in, And bathed me in sin, Til it twisted me mad. I’m waking up early to face the long day, Nobody knows me or wants me to stay, You take me for some food, You laugh at my jokes, make me feel good, I don’t want to leave your side, Or your room. I’ll be your servant, your pretty young thing, You lift me up high and call me your little prince, I’m broken open, open wounds are rotting, Memories I’ve forgotten, Locked away in the dungeons of my brain. Why, why can’t I cry? I’m not alive. I lied to stay alive. Why can't I cry? I'm not alive, I lied to stay alive. Why can't I cry? I'm not alive, I lied to stay alive. Why can't I cry? I'm not alive, I'm not alive... I still hear you say, Sometimes it’s ok, ok to cry. But this time, I know, It’s good to let go of the knife. Sometimes it’s ok, To feel this way, child, for a lie. So, I whisper to me, "Kid, we’re finally free, and it’s safe to fly."

trackinfo.title: mesmerised (act ii)
trackinfo.lyrics: Breathe in slowly, Breathe out the hurt. Lift the metaphorical trophy, Relieve your heavy burden. Nightmares clinging to my skin, They bite like mosquitoes, Blood draining, I wish I could be stronger still, I hesitate on the windowsill. Mesmerised, mesmerised, Mesmerised by the mess of it all. Dreams I’ve had since I was small, Night turns black as darkness falls, But dawn will come after it all, And make way for something beautiful. Mesmerised, mesmerised. Mesmerised by the beauty of it all. By the beauty of it all.

trackinfo.title: ghost kids v2
trackinfo.lyrics: We moved into this house, Out in the middle of nowhere, And it was raining constantly. So I tried to count all the doors, And as I searched, I found one more, Small as if for a child, And it was calling out to me. What could I do? But crawl on through, What was awaiting me? Bright and floating high, Like a balloon, I’m mesmerised by the moon. And we were drawn to this light, Now it’s too late to run. Took our souls through our eyes, When the thunder began. Now we’re just ghost kids, Got no bodies to live in, And there’s a spider’s web, That we’re all tangled up in. There’s no escape, Even from the outside. The world’s turned grey, Even if in desperation, You can stir it alive. Sometimes, I think there’s little left in hope, But I’ve seen hell up close, And heaven’s fake, so I’ll go, Running back, Wanting hugs but I’m a ghost. Now, on the other side, And how this world is bright and strange, A little too good to be true. The dreams I kept inside, Like a mum and dad radically changed, Out of their old shades of grey and blue. What could I do, but be drawn in? By all of the happenings and amazing colours, But is this for free? What would become of me? And we were drawn to this light, Now it’s too late to run. Took our souls through our eyes, When the thunder began. Now we’re just ghost kids, Got no bodies to live in, And there’s a spider’s web, That we’re all tangled up in. trackinfo.title: out of our mind
trackinfo.lyrics: Days seem longer when there’s no time. Space seems bigger when there’s no light. I’ve been thinking about, Ways to bring you out. Cos I know where you hide, Cos I’ve hidden there before. And I hope you’ll subside, Your defences a little more. Cos I’m only trying to help you, To leave the confines inside. Can you reach out, take my hand? Bring you out of our mind. Leave a note, I’ll read it soon. I’ll watch the sun like you watch the moon. Shadows live beside their light. Can I bring out of our mind? I’ve been working at this skill, Constructing dimensions at will. Places to hide in my head, When the real world is a little too real, And filled with horror and dread. Now I’m walking along a beach, But the shoreline’s still a little out of reach. I need someone to show me the way, Up the stone steps, to a home where we’re safe. And you know where I hide, Cos you’ve hidden here before. And I want to subside, My anxieties a little more. How can I know I can trust you? After every betrayal and lie. But I reach out, take your hand, Bring me out of our mind. I leave a note for you to read, It’s in this song, a secret reply. I carry with me with all my harms, Welcome me with open arms. Welcome me, welcome me, Welcome me with open arms. Welcome me, welcome me. I leave a note to say to you, I’ll be here when you ready, alright? I know the sea was rough but now it’s calm, I welcome you with open arms. I welcome you with open arms.

trackinfo.title: irys v2
trackinfo.lyrics: Summer, somehow the sun wasn’t there, But that’s Albion for you, to be fair. Autumn came, bringing amber leaves, And showers of rain. When the wind blew, I fell right through, Catch me, brother, before I descend to a plane, Of insanity, balancing the love and the hate, Inside my wee sickly brain. I remember you singing, Wake me up when September ends. I remember feeling high on believing, We will always be friends, We will always be best friends. Well we were brothers, But I was younger and caught up in gunfire, In long hill town and out there somewhere, Where a forest of falling trees, Were falling down hard on me. And I was running down the street, Stupid and sleepless, Weeping in buckets from the beach. Down in Cornwall, Even paradise is a pair of dice, In my teeth. I remember you singing, Wake me up, wake me up inside. I remember thinking are we really alright? But this life is deceiving, And death appears to be the only truth. I remember feeling high on believing, It’ll always be me and you. I will always have you two. I remember you singing, Paradise City by Guns and Roses. I remember feeling scared, That the lid on my casket was closing. Cos the darkness inside me was opening. I remember hoping, hoping, That this fear would end, end. But you and I, Yes you and I would always be best friends. Iris of my eye, Don’t you know? You were the first love of my life.

trackinfo.title: let us be young
trackinfo.lyrics: Took a train up north to see ya, It’s been a while, hasn’t it? You’ve grown a foot and I’m still a wean, But it’s nice not to have to strain when you hug me. Did I say already I missed ya? Had a dream a few weeks ago, I think. You and I were on a mountain, Climbing up a steep, sheer cliff. You wanted to dive into the water, I wanted to hold onto the warmth. You went ahead and soon I followed, Cos I ain’t letting you go, anymore. Never gone, I’m forever yours, Let me be young, forever more. Never gone, I’m forever yours, Let me be young, forever more. Forever more. Forever more. Went around to yours this evening, Found you crying on your bedroom floor. Tried to cheer you up but no laughter, You just ask, “what is any of this for?” I can’t answer without lying, So all I say is, “I’ve been there before” Sometimes, this life feels like a prison We’re just fish in a bowl swimming In circles, but with you I’m certain, That I am happier than I’ve ever been, Every day, I can wake up renewed. And though darkness still surrounds us, One day, we’ll get out, it’ll be just me and you. Never gone, I’m forever yours, Let me be young, forever more. Never gone, I’m forever yours, Let us be young, let us be young. Let us be young, let us be young. You wanted to dive into the water, I wanted to hold onto the warmth. You went ahead and soon I followed, Cos I ain’t letting you go, anymore. Never gone, I’m forever yours, Let me be young, forever more. Never gone, I’m forever yours, Let me be young, let us be young. Let us be young, let us be young. Cos I am happier than I’ve ever been, Every day, I can wake up renewed. And though darkness still surrounds us, One day, we’ll get out, it’ll be just me and you.

trackinfo.title: Unwritten Rules
trackinfo.lyrics: Little kid wearing a trench coat, Gonna make a lot of money that he’ll never receive. Gotta talk only in hushed tones, Everybody wants to meet with me. Bumping into one another, You don’t show mercy when you’re dealing with these types. Gotta laugh it off like brothers, But if they plan to kill you, they won’t tell you twice. We’ll be running at our top speed, Down the dusty lanes and through the dirty backstreets, Muddy palms on our bruised up and grazed knees, Shit never happens in suburbs like these. Anyone who isn’t frightened, Is either drugged or damn enlightened. You’ve got some moxie, but it’ll earn you nothing But a bucket of blood squeezed out of your suffering. Everybody here is armed to the teeth, Maybe only with words, but my god, it’s enough. Just one look and I can see that they’ve all got guns, And I know that this is gonna go rough. We’ll be running at our top speed, Down the dusty lanes and through the dirty backstreets, Muddy palms on our bruised up and grazed knees, Shit never happens in suburbs like these. There’s a new kid at the factory, Kinda scrawny and missing a few teeth. Gotta keep him safe in a relative sense, Guess it’s only time before we’re all dead. They stick the flour in the backseat, No-one looks there, that’s what they tell us. Just another little secret to keep, Kind of easy to do when you’re forgetful as fuck. We’ll be running at our top speed, Down the dusty lanes and through the dirty backstreets, Muddy palms on our bruised up and grazed knees, Shit never happens in suburbs like these. They say, shit never happens, in suburbs like these. One, you’ve got to keep quiet. Two, you better run and hide if you hear sirens. Three, you should always be obedient, And if you fuck it up, You can bet they won’t be lenient. We’ll be running at our top speed, Down the dusty lanes and through the dirty backstreets, Muddy palms on our bruised up and grazed knees, Shit never happens in suburbs like these. They say shit never happens in suburbs like these, And definitely not to a kid like me.

trackinfo.title: Everything Will Be Okay
trackinfo.lyrics: And I don’t know where I’m going, But I’d like to find some peace. And I remember it was heavily snowing, In a zeroes’ year’s early February. Where the water freezes up on the playground structures, And we’d break the icicles off and let our hands grow cold. Running back in and running hot water over our fingers. Burning to the touch. Burning, burning. And the corridor was stretching out, In front of my eyes, yeah, they were full of doubt, Cos I couldn’t see, and I couldn’t believe, That everything would be okay. The silence is the worst, the hurt is second, The shiver down my neck as she beckons me. I have a way out, I am not here in my head. I am dreaming, floating away instead. And I am dreaming of heaven. Running down a hill, Tripping over my feet and standing up still. Lonely sad kid pondering life, From the windowsill. What can I get when I can’t get out of this rut I’m in? What’s there to gain from the suffering? Is it all in vain? Everything will be okay.

trackinfo.title: Whale Valley
trackinfo.lyrics: Mornings come too slowly, Here in Whale Valley, I’ve been so unhappy lately. Brother, what’s there to worry about? I’m always looking around for you, On these murky moors. We rush down to the coastline, Look, how death is close by. Share a cigarette in daylight. And maybe, life is lonely, And maybe, death seemed tempting, Or maybe, there is something more. We tasted it, once before, It was sweet and salty on our tongues. Rough and real and raw and coarse, Moved through us like poison when we were young. I’ve been looking over all these shores, In our youth what was never won, Was the eternity of the pure, As soon as it bloomed, it was gone, Forever, But didn’t we try to make happy? With whatever, Could make us smile in Whale Valley. I found you in the old barn, You were steps away from paradise, Or hell, I don’t know. You scold me when I try the same, The rope to starve the brain, Hypocrisy, it’s a name you keep close. Well, time is like a dragon, Feeding off our sadness, To dream up our dreams, Ancient Leviathan. And maybe, I was a dreamer, And you were stuck here believing That only your nightmares could come to life. But the silence gets too hard to bear, When every time I call out your name, Some days it’s like you’re not even there, Even when I’m leaning on your bedframe. What if in the night, I was to shake your shoulder, What would I do if you didn’t wake? Wouldn’t I be running down to the creature, I’m speechless without the space, To fathom, Oh, just what kind of torture, Could have them all, And blow out all our torches, Forever, We were just trying to feel happy, With whatever, Could make us smile in Whale Valley. Did I ever make you smile in Whale Valley? Did I ever make you smile? We tasted it, once before, It was sweet and salty on our tongues. Rough and real and raw and coarse, Moved through us like poison when we were young. I’ve been looking over all these shores, In our youth what was never won, Was the eternity of the pure, As soon as it bloomed, it was gone, Forever, But didn’t we try to make happy? With whatever, Could make us smile in Whale Valley. Did I ever make you smile in Whale Valley? Did I ever make you smile? Well, time is like a dragon, Feeding off our sadness, To dream up our dreams, Ancient Leviathan. And maybe, I was a dreamer, And you were just stuck here believing That only your nightmares could come to life. But maybe I could make you smile.

trackinfo.title: Hospital
trackinfo.lyrics: Blue day, back when we were four or five, Seems a life away, never noticed how the time, Got away from us, faded like snow in the spring. We grew up, learned some shit the hard way, But we knew what would keep us strong through anything, You and me, but you’re not the same today. I crashed the car, you said it wasn’t my fault.
