My mother fell to shit and I heard it all. Hours went by and I was all on my own. You never visited me once in the hospital. You never visited me once. And the words that you said, They were just in my head it seems. A memory of who you were. I didn’t know you were gone, Til they let me go home. Now my whole body’s numb. Now I know why, You never visited me once. Now I know why, You never visited me once. You never visited me once. You never visited me once… I crashed the car, you said it wasn’t my fault. My mother fell to shit and I heard it all. Hours went by and I was all on my own. You never visited me once in the hospital. You never visited me once. Now I know why. Now I know why. You never visited me once in the hospital.

trackinfo.title: My Little Friend
trackinfo.lyrics: Little bug on the guitar. Where do you come from? Are you alive as we are? Soon, you’ll be gone. Soon, you’ll be gone. My little friend, Will I ever see you again? My little friend. And we come undone, And we find our feet. And we run the race, Til it’s run complete. And we build again, In a new sun. And we make some friends, And we lose some. My little friend, Will I ever see you again? My little friend, Will I ever see you again? My little friend. And you’re gone, You’re gone, you’re gone, You’re gone. Just flying away. Just flying away. My little friend, I’ll never see you again. My little friend, I’ll never see you again.

trackinfo.title: Eight Hours of Night
trackinfo.lyrics: Television screens are screaming words, Like lightning in my brain. Thoughts and feelings, unexpected turns, Of a sordid caustic age. I hear the volumes of the readings now, slowly turning me insane. I see the costume of the castaway, Hanging up in my garden now. What is there to parade in town? To feel the cold against your skin is wild. And when the wind blows does it feel like ice? Time to tune the strings to those of a child. Do you remember how it felt at night? Like insects crawling on your skin. You tried to rip the flesh from under your eyes, But it’s a vicious creature within. Well, it’s all so very clear, And then it’s all so very strange. Cos I feel love like it could conquer every fear, And then I’m spiralling and getting lost inside my brain. Life is short and crude and bitter. Death is long in the minds of the living. Death is longest in the minds of the living. Water runs through my veins, When the blood grows stale. There were words I wanted to say, But in the last light they have grown pale, Once more. Once more…

trackinfo.title: Coldest Sunrise
trackinfo.lyrics: Wander out here with me, Where the Winter seems void to these trees. Careless Autumn came carrying a breeze, Upon her shoulders. There is warmth in the slumber, Where the days are free from their number. Let’s retrace our steps back to Summer, Once more. Always caught in the space between lines. Always walking a distance behind. In the morning, please tell me I’m right, To be kind to the coldest sunrise. So come on out here with me, Where the Winter seems void to these trees. Careless Autumn came carrying a breeze, Upon her shoulders. Cos there is safety in slumber, Where the days are endless without number. Let’s retrace our steps back to Summer, And its warmth. Always caught in the space between lines. Always walking a distance behind. In the morning, please tell me I’m right, To be kind to the coldest sunrise. I’ll be kind. Always caught in the space between lines. Always walking a distance behind. In the morning, please tell me I’m right, To be kind to the coldest sunrise.

trackinfo.title: Wake Up
trackinfo.lyrics: Wake up, today could be a beautiful day. And I know tomorrow seems so far away. Cos we stayed up and we made some bad mistakes, And now the future is staring into my eyes with a gaze. Yesterday was dark, I didn’t think that we would last or escape. But now, I see the sun come out, I am glad I’m around to breathe today, And I could be okay. I think I will be okay. Wake up, it’s a beautiful day. Wake up, it’s a beautiful day, Wake up, it’s a beautiful day. Wake up, it's a beautiful day. Sunshine come our way. Sunshine has come to us at last. I try my best to find my own way home. I try not to focus on the past, Cos some things are just better off left alone. And when I’m cold, I will think of your warmth. In my soul, it’s all I need to get me through it all. And I wake up, it’s a beautiful new day. Wake up, it’s a beautiful sunny way. Wake up! Woo! Wake up…

trackinfo.title: (U) Say I'm Alright
trackinfo.lyrics: *cw: strong language* Sometimes, when I dream, I see life alight. Sometimes when I speak, I feel a little surprised. I try to make my way, But I could not just hide. Everywhere I go, I find life. And I’m calling out for you. What the hell can I do? Cos, my life’s in slow mo. And you seem everywhere I go, You are everywhere I go. Tell me I’m right, Tell me I’m right before it’s too late. What is this crime? What are you crying for, for heaven’s sake? Cos, everything is fine! I promise that everything is fine, Just give me a minute. And I will be alright, I will be alright, just cut out the bullshit. Cos, I’ve been alone inside of my mind. For far too damn long, I’ve lost some light. Even when my eyes aren’t closed, I can’t see anything, it’s always night. So, would you hold me close and say I’m alright? Would you hold me close and say I’m alright? Say I’m alright. Say I’m alright. Say I’m alright… Say I’m alright.

trackinfo.title: Summer / Ocean Eyes v3
trackinfo.lyrics: (Summer) *cw: strong language* For all my days in the sun, I’m still trying to find some warmth. I don’t know when it began, But I’ve been feeling far too cold. Like I’m dead inside my body, And I’m losing sight of my soul. My spirit’s all contorted, And I feel like I’m in a deep dark hole. Can you let me out? I just need to breathe… And the colours drown and fade out. And I am drowning deep. What can I say? I fucked it up. I stubbornly tried it my own way, And made a mess of our love. I want you to see that I’m not a bad guy. But I fall and slip underneath the ice. Would you let me breathe? Cos, this air, this ain’t right for me. And I am drowning deep in the core, Of the earth. Would you hold me close? There’s nothing I need, But to feel your wind in my hair, And your bone on my cheek. Can you lead me out of this deep ocean? I am swimming in. Cos, I’ve been dreaming of summer, Since I was just thirteen. I want to breathe in the daylight, Drink it in. But the cave I’ve been in, I am scared that the tide is high still. Can you pull me out of here? Cos, I want to feel the sunshine on my skin. And everywhere I turn, I get lost in the in-between. So, can you pull me out and hold me clean? Can you call me out of this cave I’m in? Summer, summer’s beckoning. (Ocean Eyes V3) This is the way that it falls, Sun on the first morning of summer. Everything is new, everything is pure. And everything we knew will die, And oceanize. Hold it in, hold it in. I’m sure we’ll find a way. You’ll be your younger thing, Always on its eyes. You can go in your own way, Don’t feel you have to be someone that you’re not. And you can rise out of this abyss, And wipe away your ocean eyes. What a year we’ve seen, And we have been so far in our minds. Is there anything left behind to fight? So, wipe away your ocean eyes. And wipe away your ocean eyes. And wipe away your ocean eyes. And wipe away your ocean eyes.

trackinfo.title: Home
trackinfo.lyrics: See you in the morning as my eyes open. I think through the daydreams, As I light a smoke. And when the birds chirp, and they sing out, I hear your voice. And when it’s cold out, I’m wrapped up in blankets. Just like you. Don’t hold back with your love. There’s so much pain in this world already. So, fill it up with light, Try to find some beauty; there’s plenty. And take your place up in the sky. Fly out into the forest. Try out, there’s so much for us to explore here. I’m turning out in the moonlight. And I wonder, I really wonder, If this world will be alright. If it will make it another night. And when darkness comes over my heart, I hope that I can make it home again. And when the past just tears us apart, I hope that I will have a friend. But I won’t fear the end. When it’s dark and when I’m scared, I try to find a little peace of mind. And when I’m lost and unprepared, I’ll look right through, And I dream of you.

trackinfo.title: Mother (to Mother)
trackinfo.lyrics: I see myself out of the corner of my eye. And I think to myself, who am I? Trees will wither inside my mind. I pay it no mind. You went like snow in England. Didn’t get to say goodbye. I knew it was coming. I don’t know why. Wish we had a chance to talk once more, I wish we had a chance to talk once more, Before you died. In the morning, We wake up early. We start again, it seems. We fight our way through hurt and pain, And come out on the other side, scathed. You saw that life was full of battles. To the wind, tonight, And you would hold us through the weather. Mother to mother, Guardian over all the earth. Mother to mother, Stay close in our hearts forever. Stay close in our hearts. Don’t let time tear it all apart. Mother to mother, Hold us close even though you are gone. I’ll see you soon, I’ll see you soon, I promise, In my prayers and my dreams, You are there like you were always, it seems. Mother to mother.

trackinfo.title: I'm Just a Boy
trackinfo.lyrics: *cw: strong language* Everywhere that I go, I think I fight another battle. I try my best to stay in control, But this world does not got patience for me at all. I’m turning in my sleep, I’m drowning so deep, And everything I am just falls away. Am I still the same? Am I still the same? Am I still okay? I don’t want to wake up, In two thousand years, And be forgotten like nothing, I wish that I was something more. But I am just a boy. Just staring into the void. I try to stand up tall, But the truth is that I’m just fucking small. I am just a boy. I’m turning in my grave. I’ll say a prayer for us all, Because no-one can be saved, If they don’t want it. Can you turn me out? Cos I’m scared somehow, I will fall away. And I stay up and try to work out solutions, But there’s nothing I can come up with or say, That’ll make you stay. And the daylight falls away. And I’m trying my best to stand up straight. But my knees buckle under the weight.

trackinfo.title: U (pt. II)
trackinfo.lyrics: Caught here again, Fighting my feet to turn away. Finding myself, Caught in a hellscape I create. Tear in the park, Fork in the road, I will never last. I’m scared til the end, I’m scared this will end before I feel life. Turning around, I see the things that I wish for now. I try my best, Yeah, I try my best, but it comes crashing down. I’m caught in the long grass, I’m caught in the grass, where I think there are snakes. I try to be calm, I try to be calm but there’s so much here at stake. And life blossoms lies in my head, Time falls and turns me red. When all’s said and done, I’m gone, And you were one I was hoping for, But you’re already gone. Can we turn away from here? And start anew. Find some fresh ground, And build a new place to settle down, We see the sun come up and the sun go down. And there’s no-one I’d rather be with than you. Cos, you make me feel happy and free from the truth. We can just make believe and play pretend. And you make me believe that this will never end. I don’t want this to ever end.

trackinfo.title: Blake Saw Angels (pt. III)
trackinfo.lyrics: *cw: strong language* I heard Blake saw angels, Up there in the sky. I heard Blake saw angels, Forever throughout his life. Maybe I could be like him, And see you again tonight. Cos I heard Blake saw angels, Up in the trees bright. I heard Blake saw angels, From time to time. Maybe there are demons, Lurking out in the night. Do you think they see me? And ask for a dance. Darling, would you save me? If you had the chance. Do we have a chance? I heard Blake saw angels, Up there in them trees. I heard Blake saw angels, Now they’re setting us free. I heard Blake saw angels, Up there in the sky. I heard Blake saw angels, And they’re flying to me tonight. Yeah, they’re flying to me tonight. Fly to me tonight! Fly to me tonight, oh… Caught out in the corner, I’ve been trying my best. Trying to find my feet on this place, I never get a rest. I’m turning in my sleep, I’m trying my fucking best. I see I need sleep, But there’s no slumber, there’s no rest. No shelter for my head. No shelter for my head. I heard Blake saw angels, Up there in the sky. William Blake saw angels, On the beautiful days of our lives. Maybe we’ll see angels, Flying through the sky. I swear I’ve seen angels, Every day of the night. Baby, we come alive! We come alive! I heard Blake saw angels, Up there in the trees. I heard Blake saw angels, And they’re flying home to me. I heard Blake saw angels, And now they’re setting me free. I heard Blake saw angels, And they told me to let it all be. Let it be. Darling, your soul will be free.

trackinfo.title: How to Say Goodbye
trackinfo.lyrics: I can still see you there, Smoking at the table. And I can feel the smell inside my nose, It strangely feels like home. And when I think about you, I wonder where did you go? Do we all become dust of the earth again? In the end. I can still see you there, Smoking at the dining room table. Walk out onto the grass, I go down to the hut, I want to sit at the round table. And you can tell me how I can get myself a can, Of whatever, and I will, because I’m seven. And life is so much better with a little bit of a spark. Oh, I don’t know how to say goodbye now. Oh, I don’t know how to say goodbye now. To say goodbye now. I still see you there, Smoking at the dining room table. And I feel the fresh air, As I walk around the garden, Trying to find apples. I will watch the fish swim up and down, In the pond, Because I know, That this world is just one, There’s more beyond. I… I don’t know how, How to say goodbye now. How to say goodbye now. How do I say goodbye? How do I say… …Goodbye. for grandma x

trackinfo.title: The End
trackinfo.lyrics: (Instrumental intro) Once I saw a man in conversation with a chair, He said, have you seen the news? I swear to god, it’s so unfair, This world’s in the hands of a liar and a cheat. Told a cat to swim the water, told a fish to climb a tree. Well he gathered all his coins and blew it all on a machine. Hoped he could win something, whatever that may mean, His mind was growing tired and his eyes were going. It was summer when he entered, when he left there, it was snowing. Why should I lie to my friends? I’ll tell them it’s all over, It’s all over again. Mind, is a tricky thing, friend, It’ll tell you it’s over, It’s all over again. I know it’s the end. Once I saw a girl in conversation with a pear. She asked, how did you grow so very sweet in this air? I haven’t really breathed very well this past year. I’m scared to go outside and I’m consumed by my fear. Life tends to frighten me, friend. I feel it’s all over, It’s all over again. I try, but all I do is pretend, That it isn’t really over, But I know it’s over in my head. I know it’s the end. Once I saw a boy in conversation with a cloud. He pondered its ability to hover above the ground. The sight was so unnerving that his eyes began to cry. What exactly he was crying over, he couldn’t quite say why. Death, is a morbid word, friend, For saying it’s over, It’s all over again. Blue, is the colour of my mind, Gone, butterfly, to the star-line, above me, I’m cowering like an insect. Terror comes and hugs me too tight. Light in the window, too bright. Terror comes and hugs me too tight. Light in the window, light in the window too bright. Light in the window too bright. And I know it’s the end. I know it’s the end. I know it’s the end.
trackinfo.credits: from Re: Bonfire Evening, released October 2, 2021

trackinfo.title: Alone With You
trackinfo.lyrics: I had time to kill today, So, I called you up to say, “Wanna go for a walk around the lake?” We can lie down in the summer haze. There was little for us to do, So, we just watched the branches move, In the gentle August wind. I felt low but you don’t see it. We sat around and looked away, Watched the wildlife and how it plays, Does this ever feel natural? I don’t know how to act natural. Paint the sky in colours of red, I felt a deep kind of sad when you said, “I think I might go home now.” But I felt more alone before somehow. I don’t know why but I, Felt a little ignored. When you said you liked me when I smiled, Just a little more. And it’s not unlike me to hide, So, it’s not all your fault, But you know I’m trying to be honest, So, it feels like I’m being punished, For the result. And I feel more alone with you, Than I do on my own. I feel more alone with you, Than I do on my own. I was bored when you called me along, Sat by your side but didn’t really belong, I walked a mile in the rain for you, I walked a mile in the rain for you, Sat by your side but didn’t really belong, I walked a mile in the rain for you. I don’t know why but I, Felt a little ashamed. When you said, “You’re all stressed out and isolated these days.” And it’s not unlike me to be shut off, Yeah, I know that statement holds some truth, But lately, I’ve noticed I’m more alone with you, Than I do on my own. I feel more alone with you, Than I do on my own. I feel more alone with you, Than I do on my own. I feel more alone with you, Than I do on my own. I feel more alone with you, Than I do on my own.
trackinfo.credits: from Re: Bonfire Evening, released October 2, 2021

trackinfo.title: I Don't Mind
trackinfo.lyrics: Can we talk soon sometime? I really need to hear your voice. It’s been so long in my mind. You probably think that I’m okay, And don’t panic, I’m relatively safe, But there’s some demons close behind. And they’re so loud, And no matter what I do, I can’t drown them out. It seems you’re never about, And I know I’m exaggerating that, But their noise keeps growing, every day. Off and on, turning around, Feeling unwelcome in my own house. Always shy but stupidly loud, Either I’m a child or I bring it down. Tearing up, once again, I can hear them saying my name, Too emotional, too sensitive, “No it doesn’t bother me”, “No it doesn’t bother me”, I’ll pretend like I don’t mind. Oh, I don’t mind. Every now and then I think, A little too deeply and I sink, Into my thoughts like a lake of tar. And I don’t who to turn to when, Shit hits the fan like this again, I feel I’m always about to break. Off and on, turning around, Feeling unwelcome in my own house. Always shy but stupidly loud, Either I’m a child or I bring it down. Tearing up, once again, I can hear them saying my name, Too emotional, too sensitive, “No it doesn’t bother me”, “No it doesn’t bother me.” And I feel so guilty, You’ve done so much for me, But I’m still no better. I’ve been like this for more than years, I’m starting to think that I’m the poison in me, And I won’t get better at all. But I don’t mind. I don’t mind. Don’t mind.
trackinfo.credits: from Re: Bonfire Evening, released October 2, 2021

trackinfo.title: Watering
trackinfo.lyrics: I’ll be alright, oh, I’ll be fine. Don’t worry your head, Don’t worry at all. I know you’ve been thinking, More than you should. It doesn’t help much at all, Did you really think it would? So, by the time,  That my words become obsolete, When this long night, Reached the morning, it’d be complete.
trackinfo.credits: from Re: Bonfire Evening, released October 2, 2021

trackinfo.title: Head Down
trackinfo.lyrics: I’m still learning how to be a friend to myself. And more often than not, I feel just like a mess. And more often than not, I feel worthless. And more often than not, I don’t know what to expect, So I just accept the worst, I just accept the worst. I’m standing on the docks and the shore’s full of water now. It’s not much of a shock but it’s running my plans for now. And I’m losing time and I’m losing the will. Cos every time I try, I try to try, But nothing comes from it. It’s breaking me down, it’s breaking me. What is there left now? Am I the clown of this village? Keep your head down and get on. Keep your head down and get on. Don’t think about it too much, Don’t overthink it, Even though it is so clearly fucked. Don’t let it get to you. Don’t let it possess your mind. Cos one day you are thinking too long, The next, you’re left behind. You just gotta keep your head down and get on. Gotta keep your head down and get on. Gotta keep your head down and get on. (instrumental break) I don’t want to be a part of this messed up machine, But it’s this or live so lean.
trackinfo.credits: from Re: Bonfire Evening, released October 2, 2021

trackinfo.title: Late Spring
trackinfo.lyrics: Deep dark moss, Festers in pockets of your being. Seeing angels a little more close, When you see it all through the eyes of the old. The sky is coming undone, Unravelling like a web unspun, Out of the cold and dreary ones.
trackinfo.credits: from Re: Bonfire Evening, released October 2, 2021

trackinfo.title: Nothing
trackinfo.lyrics: (Bonfire Evening) Safe life to harder than I fell, Safe means getting away, Make fuss out of every situation. Then you get it back. And I know if we’re supposed to take it, We should take it any way, But today’s a different day, Maybe, it’s okay. (Nothing) Keep your head up, don’t get down. I know I’ve said it before, But it’s gotta be reinforced somehow. Don’t be a clown. And I’m just a puppet with my head sewn up. I mean nothing, I mean nothing. I’m just a puppet and my mouth is zipped up. I’ll say nothing, I’ll say nothing, Nothing now. (instrumental break) It is chaotic that we’re all alive, On this planet, spinning wild. We don’t fall off, we don’t fall off, It is nice, But it’s dreadful in a billion other ways, Don’t you see now? Trapped in this ocean of plastic, Floating into my lungs, How had this begun? I don’t feel so good anymore. I don’t feel so good. And I’m just a puppet with my head sewn up. I mean nothing, I mean nothing. I’m just a puppet with my mouth zipped up. I’ll say nothing, I’ll say nothing. And I’m just a puppet with my head sewn up. I’ll say nothing, I’ll say nothing. I’m just a puppet with my mouth zipped up. I’ll say nothing, I’ll say nothing. (instrumental break) And the cool kids got their kicks, They’re running it out now, Making it a fast exit on your price tags now. And they’ve got boots that look nice, And shirts that are sold at an absurd price, And it’s all my mind, money. Don’t care twice, look the other way tonight, You’ll find happiness when you least expected to find it. Let’s get ice cream for dinner. Wear a smile and you’re a winner. We’ll drink coke out of our cups, Cos I’m a mumma fox and these are my kit cubs. And I’m a puppet with my head sewn up, And I mean nothing, I mean nothing. And I’m a puppet with my mouth zipped up, And I mean nothing and I’ll say nothing. Nothing, nothing, nothing…
trackinfo.credits: from Re: Bonfire Evening, released October 2, 2021

trackinfo.title: Never Won
trackinfo.lyrics: Terror will come at you from all sides, You can never know how, when or why. And if you want my advice, Keep your head down and make your strides. Time is cruel, crueller than you know. It’ll make you look like a fucking fool. Everyone knows how to avoid all these puddles, You stupid boy, you fall into them. Like a fly in a web. You should’ve known better. You should’ve known better. And deep down, I know, I can’t have known. But I hope you hear my letter. For it’s worth, you did your best. For better or worse, This is the mess with which we’re left. Pick the pieces up or…you can dwell in them, All you want. But they aren’t going nowhere. They aren’t going nowhere. They aren’t going anywhere. Take all you have and build it up, Make a house and fill yourself up with love, But it’s easier said than done, And it’s easier said… And it’s never won. Never won. Cos I can try and I can succeed, But I can never un-repeat and unconcede. I can fight and rebuild, Refix the fuckery. But it’s here and I felt all the misery. And I never won, I never won, I never won. I’ll never win, I’ll never win, no. I never won, I never won, I never won. And I’ve been sinking since the day that it begun. How did it begin? I don’t know but all I know…is I never won. I never won… and I was never going to win.
trackinfo.credits: from Re: Bonfire Evening, released October 2, 2021

trackinfo.title: We Will All Die Here
trackinfo.lyrics: From the slaughter in the kitchen, To the silence in the living room, There’s a simmering vision of rebellion, Distinct taste of venom in my wounds. On the walk through the graveyard, Their tombs are like a playground, The living and dead side by side, Heaven knife, hand in hand, And we’re ready now to empty our heads. Fill them up, ambiguous home, But unfaltering fear. We will all die here, We will all die. The mornings are harsh, The afternoons are bitter. The night’s full of screaming and fear, We will all die here, We will all die here, We will all die here, We will all die.
trackinfo.credits: from Re: Bonfire Evening, released October 2, 2021

trackinfo.title: Bare & Blind
trackinfo.lyrics: Far away from all the chaos, Of the city to the woods. I disappeared and covered my tracks, And I swore to never come back. In the distance, in this sordid light, I was wandering so lost. Wrapped my scarf around my hands twice, Upon my cheeks was forming frost. From the view of watching magpies, I was alone and a bitter old kid, Trampling branches and nettles, And tripping over roots, I was surely ignorant. And my mind and my body grew tired, I could feel my confidence paling. There was fear in my dampening eyes, As I realised, I was failing. Where will I go? When the world has spat me out, And all that’s left is this tar and my doubts. If I was to knock on your door? Would you open it slowly? Would you hold me close once more? I won’t ask for much, But a bed to rest my head, And a house so warm. The strangers round here are vicious, Violent creatures with no kindness. These are the ones that come on passing by, Looking up into the sky. And I know that I wasn’t perfect, But oh lord, is this to be kind? To tear away my innocence? And leave me bare and blind. Yet I will call on you in the morning, You can dwell upon this street, And I’ll be there at the same hour, I pray that we will meet. Where will I go? When the world has spat me out, And all that’s left is this tar and my doubts. If I was to knock on your door? Would you open it slowly? Would you hold me close once more? I won’t ask for much, But a bed to rest my head, And a house so warm. (instrumental break) Where will I go? When the world has spat me out, And all that’s left is this tar and my doubts. If I was to knock on your door? Would you open it slowly? Would you hold me close once more? I won’t ask for much, But a bed to rest my head, And a home so warm.
trackinfo.credits: from Re: Bonfire Evening, released October 2, 2021

trackinfo.title: twenty questions
trackinfo.lyrics: Staring in the mirror, confronting primal fear, Complimenting myself just to know I’m here, Everyone is gone, no-one on the throne, No place to belong, and nobody who cares. Looking for an out, wandering about, Rabid like a dog foaming at the mouth. Shout into the void, “I am just a boy!” But what is the point? Could somebody calm me down? Asking twenty questions to work out who I am. Childish protection, it doesn’t work as planned. Stare at my reflection, for as long as I can. Look into my eyes, is there something there to hand? Breaking points and white noise, I will never understand. Branches of a tree, reaching out of me, Trying to find a hideaway in the green. I remember you, do you remember me? I’m 22, while you’re stuck at thirteen. Shattered like glass, it happened so fast, I will never last, unless I fade and fold. Trying to stay calm, clinging to your arm, Look at who we are, now, so young and so old. Is there a way out? Is there a way out for me? Is there a way to set me free?

trackinfo.title: just give me a minute
trackinfo.lyrics: Just give me a minute, I’ll be there soon, I promise. I’m dodging bullets, Riding the flume, I’m sorry. I messed it up, I’m to blame for it, I know it. Just give me a minute, I’ll be back soon, I promise. I’m just frightened of what’s upcoming, I’m numbing this pain again.

trackinfo.title: apocalypse
trackinfo.lyrics: Saw the news, I couldn’t bear to read it. It’s always so bleak, I don’t think I need this. But I do, because I knew exactly what it’s meaning, Apocalypse is coming, I can feel it. Children starving, drowning in the ocean. “That’s old news”, they said, “we’re already over it.” Face down in the sand, I think I should add, “Nothing to see here,” they laughed. And it makes me so sad. Because this is where humanity is at. And it makes me so mad. It’s so shit, and this is it, apocalypse. Saved our precious lives and now it’s failing, But Rishi’s always right, he’s gonna save it! I said why not distribute the wealth a little bit? Little kid, it’s far more complicated. Planet’s on the brink, it’s all collapsing, Down the kitchen sink, it’s already happening. “we’re all in the same boat,” But this one cannot float. The hypocrisy and idiocy are maddening.

trackinfo.title: green
trackinfo.lyrics: Sunflowers and sunshine hours come to me. Numbing power, running out of this city. I’m happy, when I’m not looking at the mess we’ve made. It’s too late to change the path we’re on, it’s fate. Who am I to walk away? Who am I to decline responsibility? What is life if not learning from mistakes? Turn in the light, burn down the city. Everybody staring down, don’t look up, please don’t look now. Terrified to speak out the truth that’s on our lips. Wandering the ghostly town, no future here to be found. Little bits of diamonds thrown to cloud your judgement, kid. “Make it easy on yourself, deny the facts for the good of your health. Govie’s got deep pockets, right? Dependable levels of wealth! Have some faith, they do their best! Put your anxieties to rest! Can’t you see, kid, that we’re blessed? Stop stirring it up, you pest.” Who am I to defend the light of day? Who am I to pretend the future’s safe? What is life if not fighting for tomorrow? Dying in the sunlight, dying in the shadows. Money’s not the issue here, ignorance will cost us dear, I see landscapes changing in the blink of an eye. What the hell do I tell my kids? “There used to be these things called rainforests!” Take them to the Amazon Canyon, everything alive has died. Bury all your thoughts of rage, cause fighting just creates more pain. What do we need? Well, what do you mean? I’m just 22, and forget to eat food, Think I’ll just leave and spark a light. Don’t wanna think about all this insanity tonight. Who am I to turn my back? Who am I close my eyes upon the bad? What is life anymore? We take and we take, always wanting more. And I am tired, so tired of it all. I would like to go back, to a time that was simpler. I would like to go back, to a state of innocence. I would like to go back, to a time that was easier. I would like to go back, to the bliss of ignorance. I would like to go back.. Sunflowers and sunshine hours hum to me. Numb and sour, time to leave the city.

trackinfo.title: follow the sound
trackinfo.lyrics: Cold ties to old lies, Weather cutting through sweaters. Long nights, desperate cries, For something better. Loose ends I’ve been trying to mend, Lost myself when I lost my friend. Turning blue inside my head, Listening out for the song of the dead. I don’t know where to turn to now, Yet, I’ve been through this before, somehow, And I’ve forgotten, the keys. And I’ve got to get free, I follow the sound. Always, so afraid, Of nightmares, wee hellscapes, Tell me, tell me I’m safe, Here, where the daylight fades. Whisper words of comfort to me, Saying “god will set us free” Terror comes from every side, Turning numb in the face of the night. Through the storms and through the hail, Winter came, I still prevailed. I’ll be there when demons die, Songs in my heart means hope in my eyes.

trackinfo.title: when the world grows quiet
trackinfo.lyrics: Aimed to please, made a scene. Tried to sing, wired shut my teeth. I wish I could just reverse back through time, Like a rewind, I think of all the time I’d delete. Break my back, carrying the world. Topple the stack, it’s not yours alone. Everybody’s making mistakes, you’re not the first, To think they’re the worst. The sun will rise again, you will see. When the world grows quiet, I can feel every blade of grass. When the world grows quiet at last. Will you be here with me? To watch and see it all go pass. Riots in the streets, why do we fight? Echo and release, the fire inside. And everyone here wants to burn, From left to right. Anger’s a waste, of truth and purpose. Just a wind we chase, til the final curtain. I’m seeking an easy escape, I cannot contain, The words I’d say, if someone could hear my cry. See yourself as you are. Build a shelf for your past. Cos sometimes, you read for too long, And forget where you belong, All that is gone, yet here you are.

trackinfo.title: delusional
trackinfo.lyrics: I just don’t know what to do. I’m always imagining me and you. Maybe I’m just delusional. I’m happy dreaming, after all. I stay up late to wait for a call. I wish you missed me just a little. Maybe you do, I’m such a fool. I’m fine with faking a sense of control. You can break my heart, You can tear me apart, You can make me cry, Or you can make me yours. Cos I’m delusional. I’m delusional. I just don’t know what to do.

trackinfo.title: where the heavens hide
trackinfo.lyrics: Blessed and damned, To be living in the way I am. The time of death written on our hands. Are all things built upon these pillars of sand? I try my best, The fear of failing doesn’t hold me anymore. But I’m still looking through the window, Locked behind the door. And I fall to the floor. Waiting for the winter, Waiting for the summer, Anywhere I am I just want to leave. Pretty sure I don’t fit, Feel like I don’t exist, Half of my secrets, you wouldn’t believe. Always scared, Tired of thinking everyone’s against me, Tired of trusting the wrong people, you see. Tired of wasting time on enemies. But does anyone know? Where the heavens hide. Because I was drawn to this amber glow, But now it’s night. They took my friend, I don’t know when I’ll get to see him again. Suffice to say this isn’t the first time it’s happened. I’m always losing everyone I love, When is it enough? What the hell is this? Lost my faith in justice, got to admit, The human race is making me damn sick. I think I want to run away from this, But my legs are frozen stiff, I know, I can’t go. Save me the fall from hope, And tell me it’s already broke. Every well is going dry, And I’ve always felt alone. Tell me where the heavens hide, I’m tired of this world. All I ask, take me home. All I need, make me whole. Feel the grass of Mother Earth. Help me breathe, hold me close.

trackinfo.title: gathering
trackinfo.lyrics: Here we are, at the riverbank again. Surrender to the water. We saw the clouds, they were gathering. Like a flock of sheep, we come together. Trust your heart or trust in a prayer. there’s always something to lean upon. Maybe one day, I’ll see you there. Cos I’m haunted by the thought that you’re gone. Forever. Cold days don’t make it winter. And the rain will pour down anyway. Please don’t let time turn you bitter. I hope to learn from every mistake. Some days, I feel untethered. And sometimes, I feel so ashamed. Mind to mind, you will be remembered. Time to time, I call out your name.

trackinfo.title: final sounds
trackinfo.lyrics: I don’t know where to turn to now, Yet, I’ve been through this before, somehow, And I’ve forgotten, the keys. And I’ve got to get free, I follow the sound.

trackinfo.title: sanctuary
trackinfo.lyrics: I’d trade in all the gold in the world for the perfect tree, Sit under its branches in the shade. Time was running laps around the sea, Look at how even memories fade. I listened to the water rippling down to the lake, The mountainside is calling out your name. I’m losing this game against the wind, It’s throwing me back down again. Life is taking the mick out of me. I’m fine with it, I laugh it off, Don’t take it all so seriously. Why walk in circles? Colliding at the breach, All my dreams were born on the water’s surface. Lessons taught and learned, all the way home. Tried to think about the beauty that goes unseen. Chasing pigeons in the park, Listening to that old lab’s bark, I’m dreaming with my eyes open, it seems. Find out the secrets of the universe, They all call out to you, The sound is louder in the blue. Follow it into the green. Stronger every day, some things go my way, I am grateful for these moments of sanctuary.

trackinfo.title: the only constant
trackinfo.lyrics: Well, what are you going to make of the end of the world? What are you going to say to your children? What are you going to make of this Christmas? What are you going to make of yourself? Staring down the barrel of a gun. When I was younger, I used to stare straight into the sun. And it didn’t ruin my eyes, or maybe it did, Just a little bit, but I never realised. And everything is changing, And change is the only constant here. Yeah, everything will be changing, And it’s already changing, So, don’t fear. “It will be like this forever”, What a lie that was, that we were all told. We always think that this will last forever, But it ain’t true at all. Our minds change, our bodies decay, We grow and we change, we grow and we change. We never stay the same, That is the way of all things, That is the way. And everything will change, Yeah, change is the only constant here. Everything will be changing, And it’s already changing, So, don’t fear. Don’t fear.
trackinfo.credits: from The View From Earth, released January 1, 2021

trackinfo.title: summer went
trackinfo.lyrics: [Verse 1] Standing on the banks of some forgotten country, I remember looking out and seeing  The birds fly up from the trees. What were they doing there?  What did they make of me? Well, I bet they didn’t notice, and if they did, They just thought there’s nothing to see. [Verse 2] Well, time is an ocean and we,  We are drowning here, Surrounded by loved ones and conquering fear. Well, are we really?  Or are we lying to protect ourselves? Our egos in fragile shells. [Verse 3] This is the recipe, This is the mess you made, And I’m standing at the bed that’s still unmade. Sitting in my pyjamas, And watching weather through a screen. [Verse 4] And by autumn, it’ll be over, that’s what they said. But summer came and summer went. And the new year’s almost at our door, Have we learned anything?  Or are we still yearning for more? [Outro] This is the recipe, This is the recipe, This is the recipe, This is the recipe for nothing at all.
trackinfo.credits: from The View From Earth, released January 1, 2021

trackinfo.title: for you
trackinfo.lyrics: Staying away to find my place, And I don’t know, I don’t know, Where I’m gonna stay. I’m roaming roads and I’m roaming the roads today. Steady on my feet, as I rush back into the living room. You serve me as I drink, best down then get another one or two. I see you every day, I see you when I’m awake, I see you when I’m asleep, In my dreams, in my dreams, in my dreams, in my dreams. And I’ll hold you close, And I’ll hold your coat as you wait in the rain for me. And I’ll be there, When you need me, I’ll be there, for you, for you. For you…
trackinfo.credits: from The View From Earth, released January 1, 2021

trackinfo.title: ocean eyes
trackinfo.lyrics: This is the way that it falls, Snow on the first morning of the year. Everything is new, everything is pure, Everything we knew will die. Ocean eyes. Hold it in, hold it in. I’m sure we’ll find a way. You’ll be your younger thing, Always on its eyes. You can go in your own way, Don’t feel you have to be someone that you’re not, And you can rise out of this abyss, And wipe away your ocean eyes. What a year we’ve seen, And we have been so far in our minds. Is there any doubt left behind to fight? And wipe away your ocean eyes. And wipe away your ocean eyes. And wipe away your ocean eyes. And wipe away your ocean eyes.
trackinfo.credits: from The View From Earth, released January 1, 2021

trackinfo.title: frail young things
trackinfo.lyrics: how many more poems will it take? til I find my take-home words the words that write the memory into sweet oblivion the kind of scratches that scar the feisty blood that wraps the ice in my shivering veins and how my mind is thick with sickness and tar there are signs on this street, every street of this town like little ripples in my consciousness like fucking tidal waves in my conscience i won’t cry but i won’t smile either and like a frail young thing i am silent or screaming i am near-always waiting and i rarely know what for and there’s reasons i’ve heard that make less sense every time i hear them repeated to me just let me be let me feel let me sing if i can so, if you decide to let me in then know i won’t bolt but i won’t always show i still feel fragile i am still that kid twisting in the pale light i am still that water that drowns itself i am still that weird silence in between… breaths i am still that waking scream, that waking cry but i am… still. and open up to me like a butterfly’s wings and let me dapple in the stream of your sunlight let me be wild in your arms let me cry in your lap let me lie in the backseat of your car cos my mind’s thick with the sickness and the tar but i still feel unburdened in the shelter of your held hand i am here i will always be waiting whenever you’re ready never be scared of what we need never be scared of what we need… let me be the breath you breathe… come on and forget that abyss like those pale green things that burst the concrete come on, emerge with me we are like brilliant spheres moons that seem absent in the bright of day but come midnight we are vibrant with our gentle glow
trackinfo.credits: from The View From Earth, released January 1, 2021

trackinfo.title: autumn anxiety
trackinfo.lyrics: It’s almost over, It’s almost over, Has it really begun? Has it really begun? It’s almost over, It’s almost over, Has it really begun? Has it really begun?
trackinfo.credits: from The View From Earth, released January 1, 2021

trackinfo.title: no side wins in this war
trackinfo.lyrics: By the first light of morning, I woke to the sound and it called me out, And everyone else was running around, Like there was somewhere they should be. And I was thinking to myself, About the things that I couldn’t comprehend, All the things that I couldn’t comprehend, And how they were gnawing at my brain. And when I awoke, To the sound of you fleeing, I didn’t know where to run or turn, I didn’t know who to trust or what to think. And it scared me out of my bed, And it scared me out of breath, And I was talking to this lonesome sailor by the docks, And he said: “You know, what you get you don’t return,” “and what you know you won’t forget”, “and what you know you already know;” “for this old war is going on for so long,” “and no side wins, yeah, no side wins.” I don’t want to be your own father, I don’t want to be your own mother. I don’t want to be your only friend. I don’t want to be your oldest enemy. I don’t want to be the one you turn to for advice. I don’t want to be the one you always kinda despise. I don’t want to be the one you hire for a job. I don’t want to be the one you ever will hope is wrong. Cos you always admire me, But from a distance, you despise me. Yeah, you always admire me. From a distance, you despise me. And how long will it take? For you to admit this is the way our love goes.
trackinfo.credits: from The View From Earth, released January 1, 2021

trackinfo.title: silent words
trackinfo.lyrics: (instrumental intro) The reasons I make were a big mistake; I don’t know how to fix my life. I dream of another life. And it’s coming to the night, Where everything goes wrong,  Singing to the dark. And I know the truth is everything I do is nothing. Yeah, I know the truth is everything I do is nothing. Everything that I said wasn’t interesting to you,  It’s just like it’s never gonna end. Maybe it’s just the story, that it has no answer. It has no answer. Maybe it means that nothing’s what it seems,  Oh, it’s just so stupid, so damn stupid. Maybe it means that nothing’s what it seems, Oh, it’s just so stupid, oh, so damn stupid. And I don’t know what I said,  But everything is gonna be dead. When everything turns out wrong in your life. Everything is running out, it seems like it is breaking now,  It needs something to fix it. Everything is running out, it seems like it’s breaking now,  It needs something to fix it. Yeah, I know the truth is everything I do is nothing. Yeah, I know the truth that everything I do is nothing. Maybe it means that nothing’s what it seems,  Oh, it’s just so stupid, oh, so damn stupid. But I know the truth that everything I do is nothing.
trackinfo.credits: from The View From Earth, released January 1, 2021

trackinfo.title: decorations
trackinfo.lyrics: Out the window, are the cars and lorries, Across the road, the park is full of laughing kids, And well the trees are kind of… bare. And it’s a stretch to say that the weather’s fair. I don’t wanna be a pain at all, And I don’t wanna be a trouble. I don’t wanna say you’re wrong… …but I know I’m not. I don’t wanna see what becomes of me, In the long run, we’ll turn into something, Far from what we used to be. And I see the nightmares in my head coming to life, They say that I was just overthinking, But what if I’m not and I am right? What if I can see before we fall and now we’re gonna fall? Fall… Well, I went over to my gran’s. And we hugged despite the circumstances. And I hung up her decorations for Christmas. Yeah, I hung up her decorations for Christmas.
trackinfo.credits: from The View From Earth, released January 1, 2021

trackinfo.title: it's irrational
trackinfo.lyrics: Everyone has the time to be their own lie, I don’t know why, but I spend so much time, Trying to hide. And I see all the monsters crawling in my head, And I don’t know how to deal with them, So, I’ll just cry myself to sleep, instead. Everyone sees the world, Inside of themselves when they dream. All the things that they won’t admit in the daylight hours, Come to life. And I don’t know why, I guess I find it nice. But every time the sun shines on dandelions, On the grass verge, verges of this town, I lose a little bit of my frown. And though it’s cliché, That doesn’t make it not true. It may be irrational, But I can’t help loving you. Everyone sees the dawn, Even if it comes too early to see with your eyes. There’s a little piece of it left for you to digest with your mind. The curtains are all drawn, By the time the music starts. And when I awake, I’ll be gone by the morning, And when you say, That you never knew how I belonged, Well, this is how, this is how: With you, by my side. Holding my hand at midnight, As I rock and cry, you will be there, Saying it will be alright.
trackinfo.credits: from The View From Earth, released January 1, 2021

trackinfo.title: view of orion
trackinfo.credits: from The View From Earth, released January 1, 2021

trackinfo.title: dear
trackinfo.lyrics: I will hold you close, Though nobody knows, what will come of us. Everyone will go, everyone will rust, Everything, you know, returns to dust. Everything will pass, including us. Everything will pass, including this. Everyone will die and everyone who lives, Will testify to this meaningfulness, And you’ll say, “what do we know and what did we learn?” What is there to find in the rubble, in the rubble? I will hold you close, though nobody knows, If we need to fear, but I will hold you dear. I wish you here. In my heart and soul, You will always be, yeah, you’ll never grow old. Wisdom for my years, wisdom for my heart, I could never fear, with you, with your laughs, Ringing in my ears, ringing in my eyes, We will be alright and I hold you dear. I will hold you dear, I will hold you close. What the future holds, nobody will know. But I will hold you close, keep you in my prayers, I wish you were, but I will hold you dear. And I know, that what comes of us all; Return to dust, return to dust. What will we outgrow? Oh, nothing. Oh, nothing, oh, nothing.
trackinfo.credits: from The View From Earth, released January 1, 2021

trackinfo.title: Blame
trackinfo.lyrics: Old times and old ways, Consumed our fathers and polluted our pasts, But we won’t let it stain, The future generations. The soon to come to disasters, They warned us of years ago, We still ignore today. The tyrants in their houses, They ain’t gonna listen, Til this shit starts affecting them, And by then, it’ll be too late. The warming and the wars And all the division that remains, The violence of our histories, These are our chains to break. And I am scared, That nothing will ever be enough. That the world as we know it, Is already lost. And I’m afraid, that the planet we love, Will kill us off for our mistakes. Tell yourself what you want, But we know now, We are the ones to blame.

trackinfo.title: Little Monster
trackinfo.lyrics: Walk the walls, And paint your pictures. String-and-can calls, And football fixtures. The broken toenails, And bruised-up shins, The bundle of soft ones, That you cry in to. You little monster, Silent and screaming, You’ve got two shoulders And they’re slowly breaking. It’s all you’ve known And yet you still hope for something better, There’s something better and you know it. I freeze without cold And I wait out the moments, They rot and make me old, But I’m still hoping, And yet it takes its toll, And yet I smile as it’s snowing, We’re taking go’s, Sledging down the road. I’m a little monster, Half silent, half screaming, I’ve only two shoulders And they’re constantly shaking. It’s all I’ve known, And yet I still hope for something better, There’s something better and I know it. I ain’t breaking, I’m just evolving, From the hellhole that you trapped me in. I never had too much sin, To be loved and I know I’m enough, I am more than you could ever begin, To comprehend, you small thing, That I feared, that I cried over, And over, I am starting over, With the insight that I’m worth living. And I’ve got a world to be in now.

trackinfo.title: Time Enough
trackinfo.lyrics: Mesmerisation on the fritz, Hell-bent on heaven on Earth bullshit. Seconds til detonation hits, Local airwaves picking up heat. Well, is there time enough for me? To venture in land and out to sea. Be a better kind of free, Learn your lessons, teach them to me. Cos everyone I know is, Growing old and next in line is me. You hear what you’re told, Brainwashing for free, Childhood was cold and I’m still a wean on a lead. Still a wean on a leash. We're breaking momentum on the road, Shaking oak trees for the leaves of gold. Better take your time as it goes, Better make your mind up quick as hell, though. See the way the sea waves roll, Feel the heatwave on your skin boil. Better dead than alive alone, Better depressed than a lying fool. Cos anyone I ask says, Growing up is a hard place to be caught. Well, time enough is bullshit, A dumb fairy tale of time well spent, It’s all airy thought. And I’ve spent too many hours, Thinking about time itself. Time wasted on time wasted on myself. My mind is a scary old place to dwell. It has its highs less than its wells, And they’re often dry and burn like hell. Time wasted on time wasted on time itself. I’m wasted on my wasting of time itself. Time wasted on time wasted on myself. Life’s wasted on time wasted on myself. Cos anyone I ask says, Growing up is a hard place to be caught. Well, time enough is bullshit, A dumb fairy tale of time well spent, It’s all airy thought. Cos everyone I know is, Growing old and next in line is me. You hear what you’re told, Brainwashing for free, Childhood was cold and I’m still a wean on a lead. Still a wean on a leash. Time wasted on time wasted on time itself. I’m wasted on my wasting of time itself. Time wasted on time wasted on myself. Life’s wasted on time wasted on myself.

trackinfo.title: Silence Unfolds
trackinfo.lyrics: Let your silence unfold, The words that you locked away. Left in the cold, Swore that you would never say. Take them in hold, For it’s you that they will suffocate, A knot around your throat. And what did you see? When you really listened, To the scared thing that breathes, It’s broken but it’s living. Shoved into a corner, Neglected like a lie. But it’s part of me and I can’t ignore, And in a way, It’s my own soul that survives.

trackinfo.title: The Mess We're In
trackinfo.lyrics: The cold of the town, It never stood a chance, against us. The warmth of your love, Was always enough for me. The water was rising, The oceans were warming still. We laughed as we drank, Our feet always dangling, Over the windowsill. And all I am is things I remember, And pieces I’ve glued together. And all I have is the will to keep swimming, And distractions from over-thinking. Well, we spent our spring in the safety of houses. Summer didn’t bring respite in all the chaos. Friends I haven’t seen for months, only messages and calls. And it’s just this one thing, a part of a greater fall. And what can I do that makes a difference? Is it already over? And even if it is, who won? Well, are we sinking? Or am I on the brink of being lost? In the middle of a thought. Cos, I’ve been meaning, To understand the cost, and it is hard to breathe, When the world couldn’t care less, About the mess we’re in.

trackinfo.title: Time & Space
trackinfo.lyrics: When I’m gone, I try to say words out loud, To make me stay around. Lights are dim, this side of town, And I am always wandering at night. When my mind gets tired, Sometimes I drift in and out of time and space, And I sink, like a stone tied around my feet, I’m afraid of everything inside my head, Is it me? I don’t know. When I wake,  My eyes are heavy with the dreams, I’ve had that night. I will break and redefine what it means, To be alive and to die. When my mind gets tired, Sometimes I drift in and out of time and space, And I sink, like a stone tied around my feet, I’m afraid of everything inside my head, Is it me? I don’t know.

trackinfo.title: Small
trackinfo.lyrics: I feel ever so small, Sometimes, it feels like I’m nothing at all. Cliché, locked in a box, No escape, just the mess that’s my lot. Don’t hide, don’t run away. Leave now? You should’ve left yesterday. Break down, cry on the phone, Say how everything feels wrong. I owe you everything. You know what to do. I should be more grateful. But I am just a selfish boy, I never think twice about the damage That I cause, I’m words on a wall, And I can never find the courage. I forgive you for everything, You didn’t mean to do. I should be more grateful. I owe you everything. You knew what to do, I should be more grateful. What do you care? Do you care at all? Maybe I’ll never admit to myself how small, I felt, under your stare, I remember looking through you to the wall. I know you were lost in yourself, But that ain’t no excuse. Fuck the past, the future’s new, I’ll let it bloom, I’ll let it bloom. I’ll let it bloom, I’ll let it bloom.

trackinfo.title: Pollen Forecast
trackinfo.lyrics: I moved to Patterson’s Hill. Bought a house with a couple acres. You say you’re doing swell, Ha, you and me, we’re professional fakers. Hopped the midnight train, Going home for the summer vacation. Several months of rain, Several months and I am back at the station. If this is life, well, this is life, Well its boredom tears me apart. Cos everything’s done under the sun, And well, it just seems kinda dumb. I don’t know what to do, I just wanna hang with you, Til we’re out of the blue, Til the day we die. Red hair and red jumper. Walked to school in classic English weather. Quit everything I loved, Prayed to god that life would get better. Eat the berries, watch the trees swaying. Be a friend, be a neighbour, be a good faithful boy. Watch the telly, play the games in the yard, Have a cry and fake a smile, the latter’s your go-to card. See the waves as they crash upon Cornish sand, All of these things, in and out of my head, I won’t ever understand. I won't ever understand. If this is life, well, this is life, Well its boredom tears me apart. Cos everything’s done under the sun, And well, it just seems kinda dumb. I don’t know what to do, I just wanna hang with you, Til we’re out of the blue, Til the day we die.

trackinfo.title: Time Out
trackinfo.lyrics: Woke up early, walked to school, Played with dirt and got it in the pool, Cried in the toilets, felt like a fool. Sat alone in my maths class, Looked out the window, I almost laughed, At the nonsense in my head, Wishing to god that I was dead. And I’m always so tired, Cos I never fall asleep, As easily as I’d like to I’m plagued by a memory, Of you smiling as I’d cry, Breaking me down more every time, And I see your shadow in the doorway. Got to face the truth today, Got to play my own sad part, In this fucked up ritual’s play. I don’t need nobody’s love, I’ve got Billy with me on the rug, I’ve got shit to take care of, Really wishing for a hug. And I just need some time out, To regather my thoughts and smile, Even if it is just a disguise, I’m sure it’ll hold them safely for a while. And maybe I’ll never make my peace, Or maybe there’ll be time enough. I’m taking it day by day each week, Learning to crawl before I run. Before I run. And I just need some time out.

trackinfo.title: An Impossible Dream
trackinfo.lyrics: I might always miss the idea of you. But you aren’t, you just aren’t that. And I won’t miss you when you’re gone, Not the real you. But I will grieve the hope that kept me going, Through the years I grew. I know it’s not possible, It was never possible, It’ll never be possible, I know. It’s permanent death, As we bury the flesh, The hope retracts, And only you are left. But I’d rather live a harsh reality, Than believe in an impossible dream. There was always only the idea of you, But you aren’t, you just aren’t that. And I can feel the memory burning through, Rewriting the lies and defining the blood spilt as truth. I know it’s not possible, It was never possible, It’ll never be possible, I know. It’s permanent death, As we bury the flesh, The hope retracts, And only you are left. But I’d rather live a harsh reality, Than believe in an impossible dream. But part of me won’t give you up. And part of me won’t let you go. You’re woven in as a part I can’t cut out, Of my mind, but I will purify my soul. I’m purging your darkness, Whose seeds you had sown. And when I turn to look back, I’ll smile at how I’ve grown. I’ll leave you on your own. It’s where you feel at home. I leave because I know you won’t, Count the ways you did me wrong. I’m leaving to find home, It ain’t kneeling at your throne. I’ll leave you all alone, It’s where you belong.

trackinfo.title: Midnight Train
trackinfo.lyrics: Running on the steel road, Pavements of platforms I know. Tall grass either side of the tracks. What becomes of us all; Growing up and growing old. Cold glass, on my neck and my back. I’m riding the midnight train, Heading home once again. And I see people, the young and the old. I see all ages, and they all hold, Each other’s hands for warmth. Across from me some middle-aged men, Drunk on wine and burger king. Together for the first time in years again. Behind me, a family of four. Tired parents but the kids exhausted more, Asleep now, wildlings quieter than gentlest wind. I’m riding the midnight train, Heading home once again. And I see people, the young and the old. I see all ages, and they all hold, Each other’s hands for warmth. A loner, mysterious boy. Self-esteem all destroyed, Fretful and watching for his leave. And I see two teenage girls, Maybe nineteen years old or so, Passed out, lying down on the seats. I’m riding the midnight train, Heading home once again. And I see people, the young and the old. I see all ages, and they all hold, Each other’s hands for warmth. I'm riding the midnight train. Running on the steel road, Pavements of platforms I know. Tall grass either side of the tracks. I’m riding the midnight train, Heading home once again. And I see people, the young and the old. I see all ages, and they all hold, Each other’s hands for warmth.

trackinfo.title: Troubles
trackinfo.lyrics: I feel the wind, Come back in through the door. Winter’s coming back around. Wasn’t it summer just the day before? Where did it go? Can it be re-found? I’m in my room, staring at my screen, Tryna keep my mind off the street. They see the future as something they should keep, In a box and then push it down. I feel the pull of disillusionment, Guess it’s a commonplace feeling these days. I hear the fighting and rioting through my mobile phone, It seems the whole population is crazed. But when I walk downstairs and break my fast, I feel a kindness and warmth, the type that lasts. I wanna dive into that feeling now, Leave the arguments to the crowd. This’ll be the key, You can hold it and see, If it’s a perfect fit, Or if it’s something to leave, Behind in the wintry snowdrift. Troubles, troubles, Troubles, come back at night, Come back every morning. The grass is dead, When the don comes to the isle, And there is dread for a little while. And on the reel, there’s talk of peace at last, But my god, it vanishes so fast. I wanna cry, but my eyes are filled with stone, Cemented by all the years in the castle. Can you resign from your pessimistic post? Can we find a little hope after all? This’ll be the key, You can hold it and see, If it’s a perfect fit, Or if it’s something to leave, Behind in the wintry snowdrift. Troubles, troubles, Troubles, come back at night, Come back every morning. No, we’ll never escape, No, our shadows travel with us. No, we'll never escape, Eventually we all return to dust. No, we’ll never escape, No, we'll never escape, No, we'll never escape, Eventually we all return to dust. No, we'll never escape, No, our shadows travel with us. No, we’ll never escape, Our troubles are part of the trust, But we’ll always be brave, Yeah, we’ll always be brave. We may never escape, Eventually we’ll all return to our_ Troubles, troubles, Troubles, come back at night, Come back every morning.

trackinfo.title: Statue of Glass
trackinfo.lyrics: Pillar of the community, Brings you immunity, No reason to question, Who you are, And what you do. But I can see through you, Statue of glass, I can see through you. Keeping it upright, Always so uptight, And fixed on your image, Do you care for nothing more? I can see through you, Statue of glass, I can see through you. Make it all look nice, Orderly and neat, But what you do make of those, Who live and breathe? Make it all look pretty, Proper and tidy, But what of those who live and breathe? Do you find it all too messy? I bet, you can’t get your head around it, Being alive. You live in the spotlight, Talk through a cloth mic, Always so confident, In every word you speak. But I can see through you, Statue of glass, I can see through you. You seem so unreachable, Your secrets’ unspeakable, Keeping us invisible, And ever so small. But one day I’ll crush you, Statue of glass, One day will be your last. You make it all look nice… You don’t know anything. So bold that you fooled me. You can’t save anyone, Especially not yourself from yourself. You don’t get to decide for me, Or anyone else, or anyone else. You can’t save anyone, Especially not yourself. Make it all look nice, orderly and neat. Make it all look pretty, proper and tidy. I can see through you, I can see through you, Statue of glass, I can see through you. One day will be your last.

trackinfo.title: Forgotten
trackinfo.lyrics: I thought you cared a little for me, Guess I was wrong to have believed in that. You chose to give into the pressure, With no thought of the results of how you act. I guess I underplayed your spinelessness, And overestimated your affections. I suspect hereditary silence, On your father’s side, while your mother holds your neck. I wish you knew, The damage that you’ve wrecked, With your inaction, But I bet you’re oblivious. You were my best friend, We had each other’s backs. I suppose you lost your focus, And your eyes relaxed. You haven’t even asked me if I’m okay. And the worst part of that, Is that ain’t like you at all. You always cared for me when nobody else did, Now I feel forgotten, And you don’t even notice. I feel forgotten, And you don’t even know.

trackinfo.title: Sycamore
trackinfo.lyrics: Softly begin As a sycamore seed in the wind Rushed through a fire Washed away in sin Prophetic proclamations From an assumed position of power Pressed hands and on your knees  Like a mantis I’ll be an ornament in your calling house for a day Pale light and false decrees  Kept in line and given meaning But needing a reason to love your young seems strange Shouldn’t it come like the sun through the morning rain What do i know? The doubt speaks from a seed you’ve sown What can i say? All my thoughts just get in the way Scared into belief Remedy for grief  Darkness inside i couldn’t explain Hymns learned and sung Sweetness on my tongue Sharp and bitter to the ones unclaimed I used to spit and scowl Feel its venom in me A poisonous tree Bearing apples so red and glistening  Let me sit up high Keep my peace, deny deny Burning the corners of the page til my hands got singed What do you know? The doubt speaks from a place within Ignorance and hope Aren’t the same thing, don’t you know? Found a little calm In the balance of kindness and harm Nothing’s what it seems Living in the space between the earth and the dream And all the things unseen

trackinfo.title: Trust
trackinfo.lyrics: My mind is a strange hazy thing  But i can see flickers and embers of everything  And they move in a fiery frightened dance And with a quivering voice they try to sing  I remember the taste of mint Its the taste of dread in the morning  Of anticipation of participation In things ones never meant to mention  I remember the silence Then the sudden shutter  We’d shudder inside at it  I remember you and me running For our lives But it was only a dream It was only_ Motion sickness  (Are we past the point of fixing?) Hiding our hands In the sleeves of our jumpers Love feels distant  (A dozen young ones fishing) Is there safety in numbers? Surely there must be But maybe if there isnt Then theres a sense of trust That the sun will rise in the morning  We must believe in the spring  To trust that underneath The soils of poison A seed can grow And one day it’ll be blooming
